   21: %% Run the entire test suite:
   22: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, [batch]).
   23: %%
   24: %% Run a specific group:
   25: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, {group, foo}, [batch]).
   26: %%
   27: %% Run a specific test case:
   28: %% ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, foo, [batch]).
   29: %%
   30: %% (cd /mnt/c/$LOCAL_TESTS/26/kernel_test/ && $ERL_TOP/bin/win32/erl.exe -sname kernel-26-tester -pa c:$LOCAL_TESTS/26/test_server)
   31: %% application:set_env(kernel, test_inet_backends, true).
   32: %% S = fun() -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, [batch]) end.
   33: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, [batch]) end.
   34: %% S = fun() -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}]) end.
   35: %% S = fun(SUITE) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}]) end.
   36: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   37: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ts:run(kernel, SUITE, {group, GROUP}, [batch]) end.
   38: %% G = fun(GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   39: %% G = fun(SUITE, GROUP) -> ct:run_test([{suite, SUITE}, {group, GROUP}]) end.
   40: %% T = fun(TC) -> ts:run(kernel, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE, TC, [batch]) end.
   41: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   42: %% T = fun(TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, gen_tcp_misc_SUITE}, {group, inet_backend_socket}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   43: %% T = fun(S, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   44: %% T = fun(S, G, TC) -> ct:run_test([{suite, S}, {group, G}, {testcase, TC}]) end.
   45: %%
   46: %%
   47: %%
   48:

  123: init_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  124:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> entry with"
  125:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  126:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  127:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  128:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  129:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  130: 
  131:     kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:reset_events(),
  132: 
  133:     ?P("init_per_testcase -> done when"
  134:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  135:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  136:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  137:     Config.
  138: 
  139: end_per_testcase(_Func, Config) ->
  140:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> entry with"
  141:        "~n   Config:   ~p"
  142:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  143:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  144:        "~n   Monitors: ~p",
  145:        [Config, erlang:nodes(), links(), monitors()]),
  146: 
  147:     SysEvs = kernel_test_global_sys_monitor:events(),
  148: 
  149:     ?P("system events during test: "
  150:        "~n   ~p", [SysEvs]),
  151: 
  152:     ?P("end_per_testcase -> done with"
  153:        "~n   Nodes:    ~p"
  154:        "~n   Links:    ~p"
  155:        "~n   Monitors: ~p", [erlang:nodes(), pi(links), pi(monitors)]),
  156:     ok.
  157: 
  158: suite() ->
  159:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
  160:      {timetrap,{minutes,4}}].
  161: 
  162: all() ->
  163:     %% This is a temporary measure to ensure that we can 
  164:     %% test the socket backend without effecting *all*
  165:     %% applications on *all* machines.
  166:     %% This flag is set only for *one* host.
  167:     case ?TEST_INET_BACKENDS() of
  168:         true ->
  169:             [
  170:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  171:              {group, inet_backend_inet},
  172:              {group, inet_backend_socket},
  173:              {group, tickets}
  174:             ];
  175:         _ ->
  176:             [
  177:              {group, inet_backend_default},
  178:              {group, tickets}
  179:             ]
  180:     end.
  181:

  360: init_per_suite(Config0) ->
  361: 
  362:     ?P("init_per_suite -> entry with"
  363:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  364:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  365: 
  366:     case ?LIB:init_per_suite(Config0) of
  367:         {skip, _} = SKIP ->
  368:             SKIP;
  369: 
  370:         Config1 when is_list(Config1) ->
  371:             
  372:             ?P("init_per_suite -> end when "
  373:                "~n      Config: ~p", [Config1]),
  374:             
  375:             %% We need a monitor on this node also
  376:             kernel_test_sys_monitor:start(),
  377: 
  378:             Config1
  379:     end.
  380: 
  381: end_per_suite(Config0) ->
  382: 
  383:     ?P("end_per_suite -> entry with"
  384:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  385:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [Config0, erlang:nodes()]),
  386: 
  387:     %% Stop the local monitor
  388:     kernel_test_sys_monitor:stop(),
  389: 
  390:     Config1 = ?LIB:end_per_suite(Config0),
  391: 
  392:     ?P("end_per_suite -> "
  393:        "~n      Nodes: ~p", [erlang:nodes()]),
  394: 
  395:     Config1.
  396: 
  397: init_per_group(inet_backend_default = _GroupName, Config) ->
  398:     [{socket_create_opts, []} | Config];
  399: init_per_group(inet_backend_inet = _GroupName, Config) ->
  400:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  401:         true ->
  402:             %% The environment trumps us,
  403:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  404:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  405:         false ->
  406:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, inet}]} | Config]
  407:     end;
  408: init_per_group(inet_backend_socket = _GroupName, Config) ->
  409:     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
  410:         true ->
  411:             %% The environment trumps us,
  412:             %% so only the default group should be run!
  413:             {skip, "explicit inet backend"};
  414:         false ->
  415:             [{socket_create_opts, [{inet_backend, socket}]} | Config]
  416:     end;
  417: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  418:     Config.
  419: 
  420: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  421:     Config.
  422: 
  423: 
  424: %% Tests kernel application variables inet_default_listen_options and
  425: %% inet_default_connect_options.
  426: default_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  427:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  428:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  429:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  430:                             Addr;
  431:                         {error, Reason} ->
  432:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  433:                     end
  434:            end,
  435:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_default_options(Config, Addr) end,
  436:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  437:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  438: 
  439: do_default_options(Config, Addr) ->
  440:     %% First check the delay_send option
  441:     {true,  true,  true}  = do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr),
  442:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr),
  443:     {true,  false, false} = do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr),
  444:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr),
  445:     {false, false, false} = do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr),
  446:     {false, true,  true}  = do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr),
  447:     %% Now lets start some nodes with different combinations of options:
  448:     {true,true,true} =
  449:         do_delay_on_other_node("", fun() -> do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr) end),
  450:     {true,false,false} =
  451: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  452: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  453: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  454:     
  455:     {false,true,true} =
  456: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  457: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  458: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  459:     
  460:     {true,true,true} =
  461: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  462: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  463: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr) end),
  464:     {true,true,true} =
  465: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  466: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  467: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr) end),
  468:     {false,false,false} =
  469: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  470: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  471: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) end),
  472:     {false,true,true} =
  473: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  474: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\" "
  475: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  476: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  477: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) end),
  478:     {true,false,false} =
  479: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  480: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\" "
  481: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  482: 			       "\"[{delay_send,true}]\"",
  483: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_4(Config, Addr) end),
  484:     {true,true,true} =
  485: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  486: 			       "\"{delay_send,true}\" "
  487: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  488: 			       "\"{delay_send,true}\"",
  489: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  490:     %% Active is to dangerous and is suppressed
  491:     {true,true,true} =
  492: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  493: 			       "\"{active,false}\" "
  494: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  495: 			       "\"{active,false}\"",
  496: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) end),
  497:     {true,true,true} =
  498: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  499: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\" "
  500: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  501: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\"",
  502: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) end),
  503:     {true,true,true} =
  504: 	do_delay_on_other_node("-kernel inet_default_connect_options "
  505: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\" "
  506: 			       "-kernel inet_default_listen_options "
  507: 			       "\"[{active,false},{delay_send,true}]\"",
  508: 			       fun() -> do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) end),
  509:     ok.
  510: 
  511: 
  512: do_delay_on_other_node(XArgs, Function) ->
  513:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  514:     {ok, Node} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME,
  515:                              "-pa " ++ Dir ++ " " ++ XArgs),
  516:     Res = rpc:call(Node, erlang, apply, [Function,[]]),
  517:     ?STOP_NODE(Node),
  518:     Res.
  519: 
  520: do_delay_send_1(Config, Addr) ->
  521:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  522:     {ok, {_,PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  523:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]) of
  524:             {ok, Sock} ->
  525:                 Sock;
  526:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
  527:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
  528:         end,
  529:     {ok,S2}= gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  530:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  531:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  532:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  533:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  534:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  535:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  536:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  537: 
  538: do_delay_send_2(Config, Addr) ->
  539:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  540:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  541:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  542:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  543:     {ok, [{delay_send,B1}]} = inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  544:     {ok, [{delay_send,B2}]} = inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  545:     {ok, [{delay_send,B3}]} = inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  546:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  547:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  548:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  549:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  550: 
  551: do_delay_send_3(Config, Addr) ->
  552:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  553:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  554:     {ok,S} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  555:     {ok,S2}= gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  556:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  557:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),
  558:     {ok,[{delay_send,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[delay_send]),
  559:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  560:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  561:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  562:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  563:

  565:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,false}]),
  566:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  567:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  568:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),

  577: do_delay_send_5(Config, Addr) ->

  579:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  580:     {ok,S}   = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,false}]),
  581:     {ok,S2}  = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  582:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),
  583:     {ok,[{delay_send,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[delay_send]),

  590: do_delay_send_6(Config, Addr) ->
  591:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {delay_send,true}]),
  592:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  593:     {ok, S}  = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  594:     {ok, S2} = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  595:     {ok,[{delay_send,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[delay_send]),

  603: do_delay_send_7(Config, Addr) ->
  604:     {ok, LS} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  605:     {ok,{_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(LS),
  606:     {ok,S}   = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum, [{ip, Addr}]),
  607:     {ok,S2}  = gen_tcp:accept(LS),
  608:     {ok,[{active,B1}]}=inet:getopts(S,[active]),
  609:     {ok,[{active,B2}]}=inet:getopts(LS,[active]),
  610:     {ok,[{active,B3}]}=inet:getopts(S2,[active]),
  611:     gen_tcp:close(S2),
  612:     gen_tcp:close(S),
  613:     gen_tcp:close(LS),
  614:     {B1,B2,B3}.
  615: 
  616: %% Open a listen port and change controlling_process for it
  617: %% The result should be ok of done by the owner process,
  618: %% Otherwise is should return {error,not_owner} or similar.
  619: controlling_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  620:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  621:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  622:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  623:                             Addr;
  624:                         {error, Reason} ->
  625:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  626:                     end
  627:            end,
  628:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_controlling_process(Config, Addr) end,
  629:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  630:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  631: 
  632: do_controlling_process(Config, Addr) ->
  633:     ?P("create listen socket with:"
  634:        "~n   Addr: ~p", [Addr]),
  635:     {ok, S} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  636:     Pid2    = spawn(?MODULE, not_owner, [S]),
  637:     Pid2 ! {self(),2,control},
  638:     {error, E} = receive {2,_E} ->
  639: 			      _E
  640: 		      after 10000 -> timeout
  641: 		      end,
  642:     io:format("received ~p~n",[E]),
  643:     Pid = spawn(?MODULE,not_owner,[S]),
  644:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(S,Pid),
  645:     Pid ! {self(),1,control},
  646:     ok = receive {1,ok} ->
  647:                      ok
  648:          after 1000 -> timeout
  649:          end,
  650:     Pid ! close.
  651: 
  652: not_owner(S) ->
  653:     receive
  654: 	{From,Tag,control} ->
  655: 	    From ! {Tag,gen_tcp:controlling_process(S,self())};
  656: 	close ->
  657: 	    gen_tcp:close(S)
  658:     after 1000 ->
  659: 	    ok
  660:     end.
  661: 
  662: %% Open a listen port and assign the controlling process to
  663: %% it self, then exit and make sure the port is closed properly.
  664: controlling_process_self(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  665:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  666:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  667:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  668:                             Addr;
  669:                         {error, Reason} ->
  670:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  671:                     end
  672:            end,
  673:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_controlling_process_self(Config, Addr) end,
  674:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  675:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  676: 
  677: do_controlling_process_self(Config, Addr) ->
  678:     S = self(),
  679:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
  680:     spawn_link(fun() ->
  681: 		       {ok,Sock} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
  682: 		       S ! {socket, Sock},
  683: 		       ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(Sock,self()),
  684: 		       S ! done
  685: 	       end),
  686:     receive
  687: 	done ->
  688: 	    receive
  689: 		{socket,Sock} ->
  690: 		    process_flag(trap_exit,false),
  691: 		    %% Make sure the port is invalid after process crash
  692:                     receive after 500 -> ok end,
  693:                     case inet:port(Sock) of
  694:                         {error,einval} -> ok;
  695:                         {error,closed} -> ok % XXX gen_tcp_socket
  696:                     end
  697: 
  698: 	    end;
  699: 	Msg when element(1,Msg) /= socket ->
  700: 	    process_flag(trap_exit,false),
  701: 	    exit({unknown_msg,Msg})
  702:     end.
  703:     
  704: 
  705: %% Open a listen port and connect to it, then close the listen port
  706: %% without doing any accept.  The connected socket should receive
  707: %% a tcp_closed message.
  708: no_accept(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  709:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  710:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  711:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  712:                             Addr;
  713:                         {error, Reason} ->
  714:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  715:                     end
  716:            end,
  717:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_no_access(Config, Addr) end,
  718:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  719:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  720: 
  721: do_no_access(Config, Addr) ->
  722:     ?P("create listen socket with Addr: ~p", [Addr]),
  723:     %% LOpts = [{debug, true}],
  724:     LOpts = [],
  725:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr} | LOpts]),
  726:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  727:     ?P("create connection socket"),
  728:     %% COpts = [{debug, true}],
  729:     COpts = [],
  730:     ?P("connect to"
  731:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
  732:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Addr, Port]),
  733:     {ok, Client}    = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr} | COpts]),
  734:     ?P("close listen socket"),
  735:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
  736:     ?P("await connection socket closed"),
  737:     receive
  738:         {tcp_closed, Client} ->
  739:             ?P("connection socket closed message received => OK"),
  740:             ok
  741:     after 5000 ->
  742:             ?P("connection socket closed message *not* received => FAIL"),
  743:             ct:fail(never_closed)    
  744:     end.
  745: 
  746: %% Send several packets to a socket and close it.  All packets should
  747: %% arrive to the other end.
  748: close_with_pending_output(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  749:     ?P("~w -> entry with"
  750:        "~n      Config: ~p"
  751:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, nodes()]),
  752:     Pre = fun() ->
  753:                   ?P("~w:pre -> try start node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  754:                   case start_remote_node(?FUNCTION_NAME,
  755: 					 ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config)) of
  756:                       {ok, Node} ->
  757:                           ?P("~w:pre -> node ~p started",
  758:                              [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  759:                           Node;
  760:                       {error, {no_connection,timeout}} ->
  761:                           ?P("~w:pre -> [ERROR] no connection : timeout",
  762:                              [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  763:                           ?SKIPT("node start timeout");
  764:                       {error, Other} ->
  765:                           %% Node starting is not what this test case is about.
  766:                           %% so, if this fails, skip
  767:                           ?P("~w:pre -> [ERROR] Unexpected error:"
  768:                              "~n      ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Other]),
  769:                           ?SKIPT({failed_starting_remote_node, Other})
  770:                   end
  771:           end,
  772:     TC   = fun(Node) ->
  773:                    do_close_with_pending_output(Node, Config)
  774:            end,
  775:     Post = fun(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
  776:                    ?P("~w:post -> try stop 'remote' node ~p",
  777:                       [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
  778:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)   
  779:            end,
  780:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Pre, TC, Post).
  781: 
  782: do_close_with_pending_output(Node, Config) ->
  783:     {ok, Addr}      = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
  784:     ?P("~w -> try create listen socket", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  785:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
  786:     ?P("~w -> try get port", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  787:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
  788:     Packets         = 16,
  789:     Total           = 2048*Packets,
  790: 
  791:     Self = self(),
  792: 
  793:     ?P("~w -> try spawn sender (on ~p): "
  794:        "~n   Config:  ~p"
  795:        "~n   Addr:    ~p"
  796:        "~n   Port:    ~p"
  797:        "~n   packets: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node, Config, Addr, Port, Packets]),
  798:     Sender = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, sender,
  799: 			[Config, Self, Addr, Port, Packets]),
  800:     ?P("~w -> sender spawned (~p) - spawn reader",
  801:        [?FUNCTION_NAME, Sender]),
  802:     Reader = spawn_link(
  803: 	       fun() ->
  804: 		       Self ! {self(), "Starting - try accept"},
  805: 		       {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
  806: 		       ?P("~w -> connection accepted - recv ~w data",
  807: 			  [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total]),
  808: 		       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, true}]),    
  809: 		       Self ! {self(), "Accepted - try read"},
  810: 		       case gen_tcp:recv(A, Total) of
  811: 			   {ok, Bin} when (byte_size(Bin) =:= Total) ->
  812: 			       ?P("~w -> [OK] received expected ~w "
  813: 				  "bytes of data - "
  814: 				  "close sockets", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total]),
  815: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  816: 			       Self ! {self(), "read - expected amount of data - close socket(s)"},
  817: 			       gen_tcp:close(A),
  818: 			       gen_tcp:close(L),
  819: 			       ?P("~w -> [OK] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  820: 			       exit(ok);
  821: 			   {ok, Bin} ->
  822: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] unexpected amount "
  823: 				  "of data recv - "
  824: 				  "close sockets: "
  825: 				  "~n      Expected: ~p"
  826: 				  "~n      Received: ~p",
  827: 				  [?FUNCTION_NAME, Total, byte_size(Bin)]),
  828: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  829: 			       Self ! {self(), "read - *unexpected* amount of data - close socket(s)"},
  830: 			       gen_tcp:close(A),
  831: 			       gen_tcp:close(L),
  832: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  833: 			       ct:fail({small_packet, byte_size(Bin)});
  834: 			   Error ->
  835: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] recv failed - "
  836: 				  "close sockets: "
  837: 				  "~n      Error: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Error]),
  838: 			       ok = inet:setopts(A, [{debug, false}]),    
  839: 			       Self ! {self(), ?P("read failed - ~p - close socket(s)", [Error])},
  840: 			       (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
  841: 			       (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
  842: 			       ?P("~w -> [ERROR] done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
  843: 			       ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
  844: 		       end
  845: 	       end
  846: 	      ),
  847:     await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader).
  848: 
  849: 
  850: await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader) ->
  851:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
  852:     do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader).
  853: 
  854: do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader) ->
  855:     receive
  856: 	{'EXIT', Reader, ok} ->
  857: 	    ?P("reader terminated with success"),
  858: 	    ok;
  859: 	{'EXIT', Reader, RError} ->
  860: 	    ?P("reader terminated with failure: "
  861: 	       "~n   ~p", [RError]),
  862: 	    ct:fail({reader, RError});
  863: 
  864: 	{'EXIT', Sender, ok} ->
  865: 	    ?P("sender terminated with success"),
  866: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, undefined, Reader);
  867: 	{'EXIT', Sender, SError} ->
  868: 	    ?P("sender terminated with failure: "
  869: 	       "~n   ~p", [SError]),
  870: 	    ct:fail({sender, SError});
  871: 
  872: 	{nodedown, Node} = NODEDOWN ->
  873: 	    ?P("sender node down"),
  874: 	    ct:fail(NODEDOWN);
  875: 
  876: 	{Sender, Msg} ->
  877: 	    ?P("sender: ~s~n", [Msg]),
  878: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader);
  879: 
  880: 	{Reader, Msg} ->
  881: 	    ?P("reader: ~s~n", [Msg]),
  882: 	    do_await_reader_result(Node, Sender, Reader)
  883:     end.
  884: 
  885: sender(Config, Parent, ServerAddr, ServerPort, Packets) ->
  886:     Parent ! {self(), "starting - get local address"},
  887:     case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  888: 	{ok, LocalAddr} ->
  889: 	    Parent ! {self(), ?P("got local address ~p", [LocalAddr])},
  890: 	    X256 = lists:seq(0, 255),
  891: 	    X512 = [X256|X256],
  892: 	    X1K = [X512|X512],
  893: 	    Bin = list_to_binary([X1K|X1K]),
  894: 	    Parent ! {self(), "try connect to server"},
  895: 	    {ok, Sock} = ?CONNECT(Config, ServerAddr, ServerPort,
  896: 				  [{ip, LocalAddr}]),
  897: 	    Parent ! {self(), "connected - begin sending"},
  898: 	    send_loop(Sock, Bin, Packets),
  899: 	    Parent ! {self(), "sent - close socket"},
  900: 	    ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
  901: 	    Parent ! {self(), "done"},
  902: 	    exit(ok);
  903: 	Else ->
  904: 	    exit({skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Else])})
  905:     end.
  906: 
  907: send_loop(_Sock, _Data, 0) -> ok;
  908: send_loop(Sock, Data, Left) ->
  909:     %% ok = gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
  910:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data) of
  911: 	ok ->
  912: 	    ok;
  913:         {error, Reason} ->
  914:             ?P("[send_loop] failed send data when:"
  915: 	       "~n   Left:        ~p"
  916: 	       "~n   Reason:      ~p"
  917: 	       "~n   Socket Info: ~p", [Left, Reason, (catch inet:info(Sock))]),
  918:             exit({failed_send, Left, Reason})
  919:     end,
  920:     send_loop(Sock, Data, Left-1).
  921: 
  922: %% Test {active,N} option
  923: %% Verify operation of the {active,N} option.
  924: active_n(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  925:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
  926:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
  927:                         {ok, Addr} ->
  928:                             Addr;
  929:                         {error, Reason} ->
  930:                             throw({skip, Reason})
  931:                     end
  932:            end,
  933:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_active_n(Config, Addr) end,
  934:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
  935:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
  936: 
  937: do_active_n(Config, Addr) ->
  938:     N = 3,
  939:     LS = ok(?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active,N}, {ip, Addr}])),
  940:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  941:     %% ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-N}]),
  942:     %% The point of this is to "demonstrate" that its possible to 
  943:     %% enable and then later disable debug in one (setopts) call!
  944:     %% Note the order! Its reversed!!
  945:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{debug, false}, {active,-N}, {debug, true}]),
  946:     receive
  947:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  948:     after
  949:         5000 ->
  950:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  951:     end,
  952:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  953:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,0}]),
  954:     receive
  955:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  956:     after
  957:         5000 ->
  958:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  959:     end,
  960:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,32767}]),
  961:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,1}]),
  962:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-32769}]),
  963:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,-32768}]),
  964:     receive
  965:         {tcp_passive, LS} -> ok
  966:     after
  967:         5000 ->
  968:             exit({error,tcp_passive_failure})
  969:     end,
  970:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  971:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,N}]),
  972:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,true}]),
  973:     [{active,true}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  974:     receive
  975:         _ -> exit({error,active_n})
  976:     after
  977:         0 ->
  978:             ok
  979:     end,
  980:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,N}]),
  981:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,once}]),
  982:     [{active,once}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  983:     receive
  984:         _ -> exit({error,active_n})
  985:     after
  986:         0 ->
  987:             ok
  988:     end,
  989:     {error,einval} = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,32768}]),
  990:     ok = inet:setopts(LS, [{active,false}]),
  991:     [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS, [active])),
  992:     Port = ok(inet:port(LS)),
  993:     C = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active,N}, {ip, Addr}]) of
  994:             {ok, CS} ->
  995:                 CS;
  996:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
  997:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
  998:         end,
  999:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(C, [active])),
 1000:     S = ok(gen_tcp:accept(LS)),
 1001:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active,N}]),
 1002:     [{active,N}] = ok(inet:getopts(S, [active])),
 1003:     repeat(3,
 1004:            fun(I) ->
 1005:                    Msg = "message "++integer_to_list(I),
 1006:                    ok = gen_tcp:send(C, Msg),
 1007:                    receive
 1008:                        {tcp,S,Msg} ->
 1009:                            ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Msg)
 1010:                    after
 1011:                        5000 ->
 1012:                            exit({error,timeout})
 1013:                    end,
 1014:                    receive
 1015:                        {tcp,C,Msg} ->
 1016:                            ok
 1017:                    after
 1018:                        5000 ->
 1019:                            exit({error,timeout})
 1020:                    end
 1021:            end),
 1022:     receive
 1023:         {tcp_passive,S} ->
 1024:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(S, [active]))
 1025:     after
 1026:         5000 ->
 1027:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1028:     end,
 1029:     receive
 1030:         {tcp_passive,C} ->
 1031:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(C, [active]))
 1032:     after
 1033:         5000 ->
 1034:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1035:     end,
 1036:     LS2 = ok(?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {active,0}])),
 1037:     receive
 1038:         {tcp_passive,LS2} ->
 1039:             [{active,false}] = ok(inet:getopts(LS2, [active]))
 1040:     after
 1041:         5000 ->
 1042:             exit({error,tcp_passive})
 1043:     end,
 1044:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS2),
 1045:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C),
 1046:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 1047:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS),
 1048:     ok.
 1049: 
 1050: -define(OTP_3924_MAX_DELAY,  100).
 1051: -define(OTP_3924_MIN_FACTOR, 4).
 1052: %% Taken out of the blue, but on intra host connections
 1053: %% I expect propagation of a close to be quite fast
 1054: %% so 100 ms seems reasonable.
 1055: 
 1056: %% Tests that a socket can be closed fast enough.
 1057: otp_3924(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1058:     ?P("~w -> entry with"
 1059:        "~n      Config: ~p"
 1060:        "~n      Nodes:  ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Config, nodes()]),
 1061:     Cond = fun() ->
 1062:                    case lists:keysearch(kernel_factor, 1, Config) of
 1063:                        %% Only run this on machines that are "fast enough"...
 1064:                        {value, {kernel_factor, Factor}}
 1065:                          when (Factor =< ?OTP_3924_MIN_FACTOR) ->
 1066:                            ?P("~w:condition -> "
 1067:                               "*fast* enough (~w)", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Factor]),
 1068:                            ok;
 1069:                        _ ->
 1070:                            ?P("~w:condition -> "
 1071:                               "*not* fast enough", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1072:                            {skip, "Too slow for this test"}
 1073:                    end
 1074:            end,
 1075:     Pre = fun() ->
 1076:                   ?P("~w:pre -> which local address", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1077: 		  Addr = case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1078: 			     {ok, A} ->
 1079: 				 A;
 1080: 			     {error, Reason} ->
 1081: 				 throw({skip, Reason})
 1082: 			 end,
 1083:                   ?P("~w:pre -> calculate max delay", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1084:                   MaxDelay = (case has_superfluous_schedulers() of
 1085:                                   true -> 4;
 1086:                                   false -> 1
 1087:                               end
 1088:                               * case {erlang:system_info(debug_compiled),
 1089:                                       erlang:system_info(lock_checking)} of
 1090:                                     {true, _} -> 6;
 1091:                                     {_, true} -> 2;
 1092:                                     _ -> 1
 1093:                                 end * ?OTP_3924_MAX_DELAY),
 1094:                   ?P("~w:pre -> try start node", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1095:                   {ok, Node} = start_node(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME),
 1096:                   ?P("~w:pre -> done with: "
 1097:                      "~n      Node:     ~p"
 1098:                      "~n      MaxDelay: ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node, MaxDelay]),
 1099:                   #{addr      => Addr,
 1100: 		    node      => Node,
 1101: 		    max_delay => MaxDelay}
 1102:           end,
 1103:     TC  = fun(#{addr      := Addr,
 1104: 		node      := Node,
 1105: 		max_delay := MaxDelay}) ->
 1106:                   ?P("~w:tc -> begin", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1107:                   Res = do_otp_3924(Config, Addr, Node, MaxDelay),
 1108:                   ?P("~w:tc -> done", [?FUNCTION_NAME]),
 1109:                   Res
 1110:           end,
 1111:     Post = fun(#{node := Node}) ->
 1112:                    ?P("~w:post -> try stop node ~p", [?FUNCTION_NAME, Node]),
 1113:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 1114:            end,
 1115:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1116: 
 1117: do_otp_3924(Config, Addr, Node, MaxDelay) ->
 1118:     DataLen = 100*1024,
 1119:     Data    = otp_3924_data(DataLen),
 1120:     %% Repeat the test a couple of times to prevent the test from passing
 1121:     %% by chance.
 1122:     repeat(10, fun(N) ->
 1123:                        ok = otp_3924(Config, Addr, MaxDelay, Node, Data, DataLen, N)
 1124:                end),
 1125:     ok.
 1126: 
 1127: otp_3924(Config, Addr, MaxDelay, Node, Data, DataLen, N) ->
 1128:     {ok, L}         = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [list, {ip, Addr}, {active, false}]),
 1129:     {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1130:     Sender          = spawn_link(Node,
 1131: 				 ?MODULE,
 1132: 				 otp_3924_sender,
 1133: 				 [Config, self(), Addr, Port, Data]),
 1134:     Data = otp_3924_receive_data(L, Sender, MaxDelay, DataLen, N),
 1135:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 1136: 
 1137: otp_3924_receive_data(LSock, Sender, MaxDelay, Len, N) ->
 1138:     OP = process_flag(priority, max),
 1139:     OTE = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1140:     TimeoutRef = make_ref(),
 1141:     Data = (catch begin
 1142:                       Sender ! start,
 1143:                       {ok, Sock} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 1144:                       D = otp_3924_receive_data(Sock,
 1145:                                                 TimeoutRef,
 1146:                                                 MaxDelay,
 1147:                                                 Len,
 1148:                                                 [],
 1149:                                                 0),
 1150:                       ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1151:                       D
 1152:                   end),
 1153:     unlink(Sender),
 1154:     process_flag(trap_exit, OTE),
 1155:     process_flag(priority, OP),
 1156:     receive
 1157: 	{'EXIT', _, TimeoutRef} ->
 1158: 	    ct:fail({close_not_fast_enough,MaxDelay,N});
 1159: 	{'EXIT', Sender, Reason} ->
 1160: 	    ct:fail({sender_exited, Reason});
 1161: 	{'EXIT', _Other, Reason} ->
 1162: 	    ct:fail({linked_process_exited, Reason})
 1163:     after 0 ->
 1164: 	    case Data of
 1165: 		{'EXIT', {A,B}} ->
 1166: 		    ct:fail({A,B,N});
 1167: 		{'EXIT', Failure} ->
 1168: 		    ct:fail(Failure);
 1169: 		_ ->
 1170: 		    Data
 1171: 	    end
 1172:     end.
 1173:     
 1174: 
 1175: otp_3924_receive_data(Sock, TimeoutRef, MaxDelay, Len, Acc, AccLen) ->
 1176:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0) of
 1177: 	{ok, Data} ->
 1178: 	    NewAccLen = AccLen + length(Data),
 1179: 	    if
 1180: 		NewAccLen == Len ->
 1181: 		    {ok, TRef} = timer:exit_after(MaxDelay,
 1182:                                                   self(),
 1183:                                                   TimeoutRef),
 1184: 		    {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0),
 1185: 		    timer:cancel(TRef),
 1186: 		    lists:flatten([Acc, Data]);
 1187: 		NewAccLen > Len ->
 1188: 		    exit({received_too_much, NewAccLen});
 1189: 		true ->
 1190: 		    otp_3924_receive_data(Sock,
 1191: 					  TimeoutRef,
 1192: 					  MaxDelay,
 1193: 					  Len,
 1194: 					  [Acc, Data],
 1195: 					  NewAccLen)
 1196: 	    end;
 1197: 	{error, closed} ->
 1198: 	    exit({premature_close, AccLen});
 1199: 	Error ->
 1200: 	    exit({unexpected_error, Error})
 1201:     end.
 1202:     
 1203: otp_3924_data(Size) ->
 1204:     Block =
 1205: 	"This is a sequence of characters that will be repeated "
 1206: 	"again and again and again and again and again and ...  ",
 1207:     L = length(Block), 
 1208:     otp_3924_data(Block, [], Size div L, Size rem L).
 1209: 
 1210: otp_3924_data(_, Acc, 0, 0) ->
 1211:     lists:flatten(Acc);
 1212: otp_3924_data(_, Acc, 0, SingleLeft) ->
 1213:     otp_3924_data(false, ["."|Acc], 0, SingleLeft-1);
 1214: otp_3924_data(Block, Acc, BlockLeft, SingleLeft) ->
 1215:     otp_3924_data(Block, [Block|Acc], BlockLeft-1, SingleLeft).
 1216: 
 1217: otp_3924_sender(Config, Receiver, Addr, Port, Data) ->
 1218:     receive
 1219: 	start ->
 1220: 	    %% {ok, Sock} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [list, {ip, Addr}]),
 1221: 	    case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [list, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1222: 		{ok, Sock} ->
 1223: 		    gen_tcp:send(Sock, Data),
 1224: 		    ok = gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1225: 		    unlink(Receiver);
 1226: 		{error, eaddrinuse = Reason} ->
 1227: 		    exit({skip, Reason})
 1228: 	    end
 1229:     end.
 1230: 
 1231: 
 1232: %% Tests that a huge amount of data can be received before a close.
 1233: data_before_close(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1234:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1235:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1236:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1237:                             Addr;
 1238:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1239:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1240:                     end
 1241:            end,
 1242:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_data_before_close(Config, Addr) end,
 1243:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1244:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1245: 
 1246: do_data_before_close(Config, Addr) ->
 1247:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 1248:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [binary, {ip, Addr}]),
 1249:     {ok, {_, TcpPort}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1250:     Bytes = 256*1024,
 1251:     ?P("create 'huge sender' process"),
 1252:     spawn_link(fun() -> huge_sender(Config, Addr, TcpPort, Bytes) end),
 1253:     ?P("accept connection"),
 1254:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1255:     ?P("receive and count data"),
 1256:     case count_bytes_recv(A, 0) of
 1257:         {Bytes, Result} ->
 1258:             ?P("Success: "
 1259:                "~n   Result: ~p", [Result]);
 1260:         {Wrong, Result} ->
 1261:             ?P("Wrong Number of Bytes:"
 1262:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1263:                "~n   Got:      ~p"
 1264:                "~n   Result:   ~p", [Bytes, Wrong, Result]),
 1265:             ct:fail({wrong_count, Wrong})
 1266:     end,
 1267:     ok.
 1268: 
 1269: count_bytes_recv(Sock, Total) ->
 1270:     receive
 1271: 	{tcp, Sock, Bin} ->
 1272:             Sz = byte_size(Bin),
 1273:             ?P("count_bytes_recv -> received ~w bytes of data", [Sz]),
 1274: 	    count_bytes_recv(Sock, Total+Sz);
 1275: 	Other ->
 1276:             ?P("count_bytes_recv -> received 'other': "
 1277:                "~n   ~p", [Other]),
 1278: 	    {Total, Other}
 1279:     end.
 1280: 
 1281: huge_sender(Config, Addr, TcpPort, Bytes) ->
 1282:     ?P("huge_sender -> connect to"
 1283:        "~n   Addr: ~p"
 1284:        "~n   Port: ~p", [Addr, TcpPort]),
 1285:     %% {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, TcpPort, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1286:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, TcpPort, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1287: 	{ok, Client} ->
 1288: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> connected: sleep some"),
 1289: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1290: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> try send ~w bytes", [Bytes]),
 1291: 	    ok = gen_tcp:send(Client, make_zero_packet(Bytes)),
 1292: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> data sent: sleep some"),
 1293: 	    receive after 500 -> ok end,
 1294: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> close socket"),
 1295: 	    _ = gen_tcp:close(Client),
 1296: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> done"),
 1297: 	    ok;
 1298: 	{error, Reason} when (Reason =:= duplicate_name) ->
 1299: 	    ?P("huge_sender -> connect failed: "
 1300: 	       "~n   ~p", [Reason]),
 1301: 	    exit({skip, ?F("connect failed: ~p", [Reason])})
 1302:     end.
 1303: 
 1304: make_zero_packet(0) -> [];
 1305: make_zero_packet(N) when N rem 2 == 0 ->
 1306:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
 1307:     [P|P];
 1308: make_zero_packet(N) ->
 1309:     P = make_zero_packet(N div 2),
 1310:     [0, P|P].
 1311: 
 1312: %% OTP-2924. Test that the socket process does not crash when
 1313: %% sys:get_status(Pid) is called.
 1314: get_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1315:     {ok,{socket,Pid,_,_}} = ?LISTEN(Config, 5678,[]),
 1316:     {status,Pid,_,_} = sys:get_status(Pid).
 1317: 
 1318: -define(RECOVER_SLEEP, 60000).
 1319: -define(RETRY_SLEEP,   15000).
 1320: 
 1321: %% Open as many sockets as possible. Do this several times and check
 1322: %% that we get the same number of sockets every time.
 1323: %% Guess: This is "supposed to" test for socket leakage
 1324: %% This works badly with the socket inet_backend, so make
 1325: %% some "checks" and "adjustments"...
 1326: iter_max_socks(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1327:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(30)),
 1328:     Cond = fun() -> iter_max_socks_condition(Config) end,
 1329:     Pre  = fun() ->
 1330:                    %% This is not *nearly* enough
 1331:                    %% We have some crap machines,
 1332:                    %% which we need to "handle with care"...
 1333:                    Tries =
 1334:                        case os:type() of
 1335:                            {win32, _} ->
 1336: 			       7;
 1337:                            {unix, darwin} ->
 1338:                                10;
 1339:                            _ ->
 1340:                                20
 1341:                        end,
 1342:                    %% Run on a different node in order to
 1343:                    %% limit the effect if this test fails.
 1344:                    Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1345:                    {ok, Node} = ?START_NODE(test_iter_max_socks,
 1346:                                             "+Q 2048 -pa " ++ Dir),
 1347:                    {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 1348:                    #{addr  => Addr,
 1349:                      tries => Tries,
 1350:                      node  => Node}
 1351:            end,
 1352:     Case = fun(#{addr  := Addr,
 1353:                  tries := Tries,
 1354:                  node  := Node}) ->
 1355:                    do_iter_max_socks(Config, Addr, Tries, Node)
 1356:            end,
 1357:     Post = fun(#{node := Node}) ->
 1358:                    ?STOP_NODE(Node)
 1359:            end,
 1360:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 1361: 
 1362: -define(IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, 4096).
 1363: 
 1364: iter_max_socks_condition(Config) -> 
 1365:     case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 1366:         true ->
 1367:             case os:type() of
 1368:                 {unix, _} ->
 1369:                     MaxNumOpenFilesStr =
 1370:                         string:trim(os:cmd("ulimit -n")),
 1371:                     try list_to_integer(MaxNumOpenFilesStr) of
 1372:                         MaxNumOpenFile when
 1373:                               (MaxNumOpenFile =< ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT) ->
 1374:                             ok;
 1375:                         MaxNumOpenFile ->
 1376:                             {skip, ?F("ulimit -n: ~w (> ~w)",
 1377:                                       [MaxNumOpenFile, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT])}
 1378:                     catch
 1379:                         _:_:_ ->
 1380:                             %% Skip just to be on the safe side
 1381:                             {skip, "Works badly with the socket inet_backend"}
 1382:                     end;
 1383:                 _ ->
 1384:                     ok
 1385:             end;
 1386:         false ->
 1387:             ok
 1388:     end.
 1389: 
 1390:    
 1391: do_iter_max_socks(Config, Addr, Tries, Node) ->
 1392:     Self = self(),
 1393:     L = iter_max_socks_run(
 1394:           Node,
 1395:           fun() ->
 1396:                   exit(iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Self, Tries, initialize))
 1397:           end),
 1398:     ?P("Result: "
 1399:        "~n   ~p", [L]),
 1400:     all_equal(L),
 1401:     {comment, "Max sockets: " ++ integer_to_list(hd(L))}.
 1402: 
 1403: iter_max_socks_run(Node, F) ->
 1404:     try erlang:spawn_opt(Node, F, [monitor]) of
 1405:         {Pid, MRef} when is_pid(Pid) andalso is_reference(MRef) ->
 1406:             iter_max_socks_await_runner(Node, Pid, MRef);
 1407:         _Any ->
 1408:             ?P("Unexpected process start result: "
 1409:                "~n   ~p", [_Any]),
 1410:             {skip, "Failed starting iterator (remote) process"}
 1411:     catch
 1412:         C:E:S ->
 1413:             ?P("Failed starting iterator (remote) process: "
 1414:                "~n   Class: ~p"
 1415:                "~n   Error: ~p"
 1416:                "~n   Stack: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 1417:             {skip, "Failed starting iterator (remote) process"}
 1418:     end.
 1419: 
 1420: iter_max_socks_await_runner(Node, Pid, MRef) ->
 1421:     erlang:monitor_node(Node, true),
 1422:     Start = millis(),
 1423:     iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Start).
 1424: 
 1425: iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp) ->
 1426:     receive
 1427:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Res} ->
 1428:             T = millis(),
 1429:             ?P("received runner result after ~w ms "
 1430:                  "(~w ms since last status)", [T - Start, T - Timestamp]),
 1431:             erlang:monitor_node(Node, false),
 1432:             Res;
 1433: 
 1434:         {nodedown, Node} = NODEDOWN ->
 1435:             ?P("Received unexpected ~p 'nodedown'", [Node]),
 1436:             NODEDOWN;
 1437: 
 1438:         {status, Action, Info} ->
 1439:             T = millis(),
 1440:             ?P("Received status message (after ~w ms) from the runner ~p: "
 1441:                "~n   ~p => ~p", [T - Timestamp, Pid, Action, Info]),
 1442:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, T);
 1443: 
 1444:         Any ->
 1445:             ?P("Received unexpected message while waiting for the runner ~p: "
 1446:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, Any]),
 1447:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp)
 1448: 
 1449:     after 5000 ->
 1450:             ?P("timeout while waiting for the runner ~p", [Pid]),
 1451:             iter_max_socks_await_runner2(Node, Pid, MRef, Start, Timestamp)
 1452:     end.
 1453: 
 1454:              
 1455: iter_max_socks_runner(_Config, _Addr, _Parent, 0, _) ->
 1456:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(0,-) -> done"),
 1457:     [];
 1458: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, initialize = First) ->
 1459:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1460:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1461:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1462:     [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, MS)];
 1463: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, failed = First) ->
 1464:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1465:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1466:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1467:     [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1468: iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N, First) when is_integer(First) ->
 1469:     ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> entry", [N, First]),
 1470:     Parent ! {status, start_socks_counting, First},
 1471:     MS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1472:     if
 1473:         (MS =:= First) -> 
 1474: 	    [MS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1475:        true ->
 1476: 	    ?P("~w =/= ~w => sleeping for ~p seconds...",
 1477:                [MS, First, ?RETRY_SLEEP/1000]), 
 1478: 	    receive after ?RETRY_SLEEP -> ok end,
 1479: 	    ?P("iter_max_socks_runner(~w,~w) -> trying again", [N, First]),
 1480:             Parent ! {status, retry_socks_counting, {First, MS}},
 1481: 	    RetryMS = max_socks(Config, Addr),
 1482: 	    if RetryMS == First ->
 1483:                     [RetryMS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, First)];
 1484:                true ->
 1485:                     [RetryMS|iter_max_socks_runner(Config, Addr, Parent, N-1, failed)]
 1486:             end
 1487:     end.
 1488: 
 1489: all_equal({skip, _} = SKIP) ->
 1490:     throw(SKIP);
 1491: all_equal([]) ->
 1492:     ok;
 1493: all_equal([Rule | T]) ->
 1494:     all_equal(Rule, T).
 1495: 
 1496: all_equal(Rule, [Rule | T]) ->
 1497:     all_equal(Rule, T);
 1498: all_equal(_, [_ | _]) ->
 1499:     ct:sleep(?RECOVER_SLEEP), % Wait a while and *hope* that we'll
 1500:                               % recover so other tests won't be
 1501:                               % affected.
 1502:     ct:fail(max_socket_mismatch);
 1503: all_equal(_Rule, []) ->
 1504:     ok.
 1505: 
 1506: max_socks(Config, Addr) ->
 1507:     put(state, open),
 1508:     Socks = case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 1509: 		true ->
 1510: 		    case os:type() of
 1511: 			{win32, nt} ->
 1512: 			    %% 'socket' behaves differently
 1513: 			    %% on Windows, so this test case
 1514: 			    %% needs a lot of tweaking...
 1515: 			    open_socks(Config,
 1516: 				       ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT div 2,
 1517: 				       Addr);
 1518: 			_ ->
 1519: 			    open_socks(Config, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, Addr)
 1520: 		    end;
 1521: 		_ ->
 1522: 		    open_socks(Config, ?IMS_MAX_ULIMIT, Addr)
 1523: 
 1524: 	    end,			    
 1525:     N = length(Socks),
 1526:     put(state, close),
 1527:     lists:foreach(fun(S) -> ok = gen_tcp:close(S) end, Socks),
 1528:     put(state, ready),
 1529:     ?P("Got ~p sockets", [N]),
 1530:     N.
 1531: 
 1532: %% We loop *either* until:
 1533: %% a) We cannot create more sockets
 1534: %% b) We have reached the max number of open sockets.
 1535: %%    Going passed this limit will make the system unstable
 1536: open_socks(Config, N, Addr) ->
 1537:     case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1538: 	{ok, L} ->
 1539: 	    {ok, {_, Port}} = inet:sockname(L),
 1540: 	    [L | connect_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1541: 	_ ->
 1542: 	    []
 1543:     end.
 1544: 
 1545: 
 1546: connect_accept(Config, N, L, Addr, Port) when (N > 0) ->
 1547:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1548: 	{ok, C} ->
 1549: 	    [C | do_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1550: 	_ ->
 1551: 	    []
 1552:     end;
 1553: connect_accept(_, _, _, _, _) ->
 1554:     [].
 1555: 
 1556: 
 1557: do_accept(Config, N, L, Addr, Port) ->
 1558:     case gen_tcp:accept(L) of
 1559: 	{ok, A} -> [A | connect_accept(Config, N-1, L, Addr, Port)];
 1560: 	_ -> []
 1561:     end.
 1562: 
 1563: start_node(Name) ->
 1564:     Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1565:     ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa).
 1566: 
 1567: %% start_node(Name0, InetBackend) ->
 1568: %%     Name = list_to_atom(?F("~w_~w", [Name0, InetBackend])),
 1569: %%     start_node(Name).
 1570: 
 1571: start_remote_node(Name0, InetBackend) ->
 1572:      Name = list_to_atom(?F("~w_~w", [Name0, InetBackend])),
 1573:      Pa = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1574:      Opts = [{remote, true}, {fail_on_error, false}],
 1575:      ?START_NODE(Name, "-pa " ++ Pa, Opts).
 1576: 
 1577: %% Tests that when 'the other side' on a passive socket closes, the
 1578: %% connecting side can still read until the end of data.
 1579: passive_sockets(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1580:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1581:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1582:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1583:                             Addr;
 1584:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1585:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1586:                     end
 1587:            end,
 1588:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_passive_sockets(Config, Addr) end,
 1589:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1590:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1591: 
 1592: 
 1593: do_passive_sockets(Config, Addr) ->
 1594:     ME = self(),
 1595:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1596:                        passive_sockets_server(Config,
 1597:                                               [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}],
 1598:                                               ME)
 1599:                end),
 1600:     receive
 1601:         {socket,Port} -> ok
 1602:     end,
 1603:     ct:sleep(500),
 1604:     case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 1605:         {ok, Sock} ->
 1606:             passive_sockets_read(Sock);
 1607:         {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1608:             {skip, connect_failed_str(Reason)};
 1609:         Error ->
 1610:             ct:fail({"Could not connect to server", Error})
 1611:     end.
 1612: 
 1613: %%
 1614: %% Read until we get an {error, closed}. If we get another error, this test case
 1615: %% should fail.
 1616: %%
 1617: passive_sockets_read(Sock) ->
 1618:     case gen_tcp:recv(Sock, 0, 2000) of
 1619: 	{ok, Data} ->
 1620: 	    io:format("Received ~p bytes~n", [length(Data)]),
 1621: 	    passive_sockets_read(Sock);
 1622: 	{error, closed} ->
 1623: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock);
 1624: 	Error ->
 1625: 	    gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 1626: 	    ct:fail({"Did not get {error, closed} before other error", Error})
 1627:     end.
 1628: 
 1629: passive_sockets_server(Config, Opts, Parent) ->
 1630:     case ?LISTEN(Config, 0, Opts) of
 1631:         {ok, LSock} ->
 1632:             {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(LSock),
 1633:             Parent ! {socket,Port},
 1634:             passive_sockets_server_accept(LSock);
 1635:         Error ->
 1636:             ct:fail({"Could not create listen socket", Error})
 1637:     end.
 1638: 
 1639: passive_sockets_server_accept(Sock) ->
 1640:     case gen_tcp:accept(Sock) of
 1641:         {ok, Socket} ->
 1642:             timer:sleep(500),			% Simulate latency
 1643:             passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, 5),
 1644:             passive_sockets_server_accept(Sock);
 1645:         Error ->
 1646:             ct:fail({"Could not accept connection", Error})
 1647:     end.
 1648: 
 1649: passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, 0) ->
 1650:     io:format("Closing other end..~n", []),
 1651:     gen_tcp:close(Socket);
 1652: passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, X) ->
 1653:     Data = lists:duplicate(1024*X, $a),
 1654:     case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Data) of
 1655:         ok ->
 1656:             ct:sleep(50),   % Simulate some processing.
 1657:             passive_sockets_server_send(Socket, X-1);
 1658:         {error, _Reason} ->
 1659:             ct:fail("Failed to send data")
 1660:     end.
 1661: 
 1662: 
 1663: %% Tests the return value from gen_tcp:accept when
 1664: %% the socket is closed from another process. (OTP-3817)
 1665: accept_closed_by_other_process(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1666:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1667:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1668:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1669:                             Addr;
 1670:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1671:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1672:                     end
 1673:            end,
 1674:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_accept_closed_by_other_process(Config, Addr) end,
 1675:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1676:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1677: 
 1678: do_accept_closed_by_other_process(Config, Addr) ->
 1679:     Parent = self(),
 1680:     {ok, ListenSocket} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1681:     Child =
 1682: 	spawn_link(
 1683: 	  fun() ->
 1684: 		  Parent ! {self(), gen_tcp:accept(ListenSocket)}
 1685: 	  end),
 1686:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1687:     ok = gen_tcp:close(ListenSocket),
 1688:     receive
 1689:         {Child, {error, closed}} ->
 1690:             ok;
 1691:         {Child, Other} ->
 1692:             ct:fail({"Wrong result of gen_tcp:accept", Other})
 1693:     end.
 1694: 
 1695: repeat(N, Fun) ->
 1696:     repeat(N, N, Fun).
 1697: 
 1698: repeat(N, T, Fun) when is_integer(N), N > 0 ->
 1699:     Fun(T-N),
 1700:     repeat(N-1, T, Fun);
 1701: repeat(_, _, _) ->
 1702:     ok.
 1703: 
 1704: 
 1705: %% Tests the response when using a closed socket as argument.
 1706: closed_socket(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1707:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1708:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1709:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1710:                             Addr;
 1711:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1712:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1713:                     end
 1714:            end,
 1715:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_closed_socket(Config, Addr) end,
 1716:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1717:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1718: 
 1719: do_closed_socket(Config, Addr) ->
 1720:     {ok, LS1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 1721:     erlang:yield(),
 1722:     ok = gen_tcp:close(LS1),
 1723:     %% If the following delay is uncommented, the result error values
 1724:     %% below will change from {error, einval} to {error, closed} since
 1725:     %% inet_db then will have noticed that the socket is closed.
 1726:     %% This is a scheduling issue, i.e when the gen_server in 
 1727:     %% in inet_db processes the 'EXIT' message from the port,
 1728:     %% the socket is unregistered.
 1729:     %%
 1730:     %% ct:sleep({seconds,2})
 1731:     %%
 1732:     {error, R_send}   = gen_tcp:send(LS1, "data"),
 1733:     {error, R_recv}   = gen_tcp:recv(LS1, 17),
 1734:     {error, R_accept} = gen_tcp:accept(LS1),
 1735:     {error, R_controlling_process} =
 1736: 	gen_tcp:controlling_process(LS1, self()),
 1737:     %%
 1738:     ok = ?P("R_send = ~p", [R_send]),
 1739:     ok = ?P("R_recv = ~p", [R_recv]),
 1740:     ok = ?P("R_accept = ~p", [R_accept]),
 1741:     ok = ?P("R_controlling_process = ~p", [R_controlling_process]),
 1742:     ok.
 1743: 
 1744: %%%
 1745: %%% Test using the gen_tcp:shutdown/2 function using a sort server.
 1746: %%% 
 1747: 
 1748: shutdown_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1749:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1750:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1751:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1752:                             Addr;
 1753:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1754:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1755:                     end
 1756:            end,
 1757:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> shutdown_common(Config, Addr, true) end,
 1758:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1759:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1760: 
 1761: shutdown_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1762:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1763:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1764:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1765:                             Addr;
 1766:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1767:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1768:                     end
 1769:            end,
 1770:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> shutdown_common(Config, Addr, false) end,
 1771:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1772:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1773: 
 1774: shutdown_common(Config, Addr, Active) ->
 1775:     ?P("start sort server"),
 1776:     P = sort_server(Config, Addr, Active),
 1777:     ?P("Sort server port: ~p", [P]),
 1778: 
 1779: 
 1780:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1781:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["glurf"]),
 1782:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["abc","nisse","dum"]),
 1783: 
 1784:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 255)]),
 1785:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(77, 999)]),
 1786:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 55)]),
 1787:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1788:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["apa"]),
 1789:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, ["kluns","gorilla"]),
 1790:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, [lists:reverse(integer_to_list(I)) || I <- lists:seq(25, 1233)]),
 1791:     do_sort(Config, Addr, P, []),
 1792:     receive
 1793: 	Any ->
 1794: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_message,Any})
 1795:     after 0 -> ok
 1796:     end.
 1797: 
 1798: do_sort(Config, Addr, P, List0) ->
 1799:     ?P("Sort: "
 1800:        "~n   ~p", [List0]),
 1801:     List = [El++"\n" || El <- List0],
 1802:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, P, [{ip, Addr}, {packet,line}]) of
 1803:             {ok, Socket} ->
 1804:                 Socket;
 1805:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1806:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1807:         end,
 1808:     %% ok = inet:setopts(S, [{debug, true}]),
 1809:     ?P("Send Lines: "
 1810:        "~n   ~p", [List]),
 1811:     send_lines(S, List),
 1812:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1813:     Lines = collect_lines(S, true),
 1814:     ?P("Collected: "
 1815:        "~n   ~p", [Lines]),
 1816:     SortedLines = lists:sort(List),
 1817:     ?P("Sorted: "
 1818:        "~n   ~p", [SortedLines]),
 1819:     case SortedLines of
 1820:         Lines ->
 1821:             ok;
 1822:         _ ->
 1823:             LmSL = Lines -- SortedLines,
 1824:             SLmL = SortedLines -- Lines,
 1825:             ?P("Not identical after sorting:"
 1826:                "~n   Lines -- SortedLines: "
 1827:                "~n      ~p"
 1828:                "~n   SortedLines -- Lines: "
 1829:                "~n      ~p", [LmSL, SLmL]),
 1830:             Lines = SortedLines
 1831:     end,
 1832:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S).
 1833: 
 1834: sort_server(Config, Addr, Active) ->
 1835:     Opts = [{ip, Addr}, {exit_on_close,false},{packet,line},{active,Active}],
 1836:     {ok,L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, Opts),
 1837:     Go = make_ref(),
 1838:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() ->
 1839:                              receive Go -> sort_server_1(L, Active) end
 1840:                      end),
 1841:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(L, Pid),
 1842:     Pid ! Go,
 1843:     {ok,Port} = inet:port(L),
 1844:     Port.
 1845: 
 1846: %% Acceptor loop
 1847: sort_server_1(L, Active) ->
 1848:     {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1849:     Go = make_ref(),
 1850:     Sorter = spawn(fun() -> receive Go -> sorter(S, Active) end end),
 1851:     ok = gen_tcp:controlling_process(S, Sorter),
 1852:     Sorter ! Go,
 1853:     sort_server_1(L, Active).
 1854: 
 1855: %% Sorter
 1856: sorter(S, Active) ->
 1857:     ?P("[sorter] try receive lines for sorting"),
 1858:     Lines = collect_lines(S, Active),
 1859:     SortedLines = lists:sort(Lines),
 1860:     ?P("[sorter]"
 1861:        "~n   received Lines: "
 1862:        "~n      ~p"
 1863:        "~n   (send) sorted Lines: "
 1864:        "~n      ~p", [Lines, SortedLines]),
 1865:     send_lines(S, SortedLines),
 1866:     gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1867:     gen_tcp:close(S).
 1868: 
 1869: collect_lines(S, true) ->
 1870:     collect_lines_1(S, []);
 1871: collect_lines(S, false) ->
 1872:     passive_collect_lines_1(S, []).
 1873: 
 1874: collect_lines_1(S, Acc) ->
 1875:     receive
 1876: 	{tcp,S,Line} ->
 1877:             ?P("collect_lines_1(~w): ~p", [S, Line]),
 1878:             collect_lines_1(S, [Line|Acc]);
 1879: 	{tcp_closed,S} ->
 1880:             ?P("collect_lines_1(~w): tcp_closed", [S]),
 1881:             lists:reverse(Acc)
 1882:     end.
 1883: 
 1884: passive_collect_lines_1(S, Acc) ->
 1885:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 1886: 	{ok,Line} -> passive_collect_lines_1(S, [Line|Acc]);
 1887: 	{error,closed} -> lists:reverse(Acc)
 1888:     end.
 1889: 
 1890: 
 1891: send_lines(S, Lines) ->    
 1892:     lists:foreach(fun(Line) ->
 1893:                           ?P("send_line(~w): ~p", [S, Line]),
 1894: 			  ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Line)
 1895: 		  end, Lines).
 1896: 
 1897: %%%
 1898: %%% Shutdown pending.
 1899: %%%
 1900: 
 1901: shutdown_pending(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1902:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1903:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1904:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1905:                             Addr;
 1906:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1907:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 1908:                     end
 1909:            end,
 1910:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_shutdown_pending(Config, Addr) end,
 1911:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 1912:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 1913: 
 1914: do_shutdown_pending(Config, Addr) ->
 1915:     N = 512*1024+17,
 1916:     ?P("N: ~p", [N]),
 1917:     Data = [<<N:32>>,ones(N),42],
 1918:     {Port, Pid} = a_server(Config, Addr),
 1919:     ?P("try connect to server (port: ~p)", [Port]),
 1920:     S = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{ip, Addr}]) of
 1921:             {ok, Socket} ->
 1922:                 ?P("connected"),
 1923:                 Socket;
 1924:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 1925:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 1926:         end,
 1927:     ?P("send"),
 1928:     gen_tcp:send(S, Data),
 1929:     ?P("shutdown(write)"),
 1930:     gen_tcp:shutdown(S, write),
 1931:     ?P("await data message"),
 1932:     case sp_await_data(Pid, S) of
 1933:         N ->
 1934:             ok;
 1935:         InvalidN ->
 1936:             ?P("Invalid message: "
 1937:                "~n   Expected: ~p"
 1938:                "~n   Received: ~p", [N, InvalidN]),
 1939:             ct:fail({unexpected_msg, N, InvalidN})
 1940:     end,
 1941:     ?P("done"),
 1942:     ok.
 1943: 
 1944: sp_await_data(Pid, Sock) ->
 1945:     receive
 1946:         {tcp, Sock, Msg} ->
 1947:             ?P("got tcp (data) message: ~p", [Msg]),
 1948:             list_to_integer(Msg) - 5;
 1949:         {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
 1950:             ?P("server exited normal"),
 1951:             sp_await_data(Pid, Sock);
 1952:         Other ->
 1953:             ?P("UNEXPECTED: "
 1954:                "~n   ~p", [Other]),
 1955:             ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
 1956:     end.
 1957: 
 1958:  ones(0) -> [];
 1959:  ones(1) -> [1];
 1960:  ones(N) ->
 1961:      Half = N div 2,
 1962:      Ones = ones(Half),
 1963:      case 2*Half of
 1964: 	 N -> [Ones|Ones];
 1965: 	 _ -> [1,Ones|Ones]
 1966:      end.
 1967: 
 1968: a_server(Config, Addr) ->
 1969:      {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}, {exit_on_close,false},{active,false}]),
 1970:      Pid        = spawn_link(fun() -> a_server2(L) end),
 1971:      ok         = gen_tcp:controlling_process(L, Pid),
 1972:      {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 1973:      {Port, Pid}.
 1974: 
 1975: a_server2(L) ->
 1976:      {ok,S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 1977:      do_recv(S, []).
 1978: 
 1979:  do_recv(S, Bs0) ->
 1980:      case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 1981: 	 {ok,B} ->
 1982: 	     do_recv(S, [Bs0,B]);
 1983: 	 {error,closed} ->
 1984: 	     Bs = list_to_binary(Bs0),
 1985: 	     gen_tcp:send(S, integer_to_list(byte_size(Bs))),
 1986: 	     gen_tcp:close(S)
 1987:      end.
 1988: 
 1989: %%
 1990: %% Test 'show_econnreset' option
 1991: %%
 1992: 
 1993: show_econnreset_active(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1994:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 1995:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 1996:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 1997:                             Addr;
 1998:                         {error, Reason} ->
 1999:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2000:                     end
 2001:            end,
 2002:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_active(Config, Addr) end,
 2003:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2004:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2005: 
 2006: do_show_econnreset_active(Config, Addr) ->
 2007:     %% First confirm everything works with option turned off.
 2008:     ?P("test with option switched off (default)"),
 2009:     {ok, L0} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 2010:     {ok, Port0} = inet:port(L0),
 2011:     Client0 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port0,
 2012:                             [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2013:                  {ok, CSock0} ->
 2014:                      CSock0;
 2015:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason0} ->
 2016:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason0))
 2017:               end,
 2018:     {ok, S0} = gen_tcp:accept(L0),
 2019:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L0),
 2020:     ok = inet:setopts(Client0, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2021:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client0),
 2022:     receive
 2023:        {tcp_closed, S0} ->
 2024: 	   ok;
 2025:        Other0 ->
 2026: 	   ct:fail({unexpected, off, closed, Other0})
 2027:     after 1000 ->
 2028: 	ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2029:     end,
 2030: 
 2031:     %% Now test with option switched on.
 2032:     %% Note: We are also testing that the show_econnreset option is
 2033:     %% inherited from the listening socket by the accepting socket.
 2034:     ?P("test with option explicitly switched on"),
 2035:     {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{show_econnreset, true}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2036:     {ok, Port1} = inet:port(L1),
 2037:     Client1 = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port1,
 2038:                             [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2039:                   {ok, CSock1} ->
 2040:                       CSock1;
 2041:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2042:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2043:               end,
 2044:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:accept(L1),
 2045:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),
 2046:     ok = inet:setopts(Client1, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2047:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client1),
 2048:     receive
 2049: 	{tcp_error, S1, econnreset} ->
 2050: 	    receive
 2051: 		{tcp_closed, S1} ->
 2052:                     ?P("done"),
 2053: 		    ok;
 2054: 		Other1 ->
 2055:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED (expected closed):"
 2056:                        "~n   ~p", [Other1]),
 2057: 		    ct:fail({unexpected, on, closed, Other1})
 2058: 	    after 1 ->
 2059:                     ?P("UNEXPECTED timeout (expected closed)"),
 2060:                     ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2061: 	    end;
 2062: 	Other2 ->
 2063:             ?P("UNEXPECTED (expected error:econnreset):"
 2064:                "~n   ~p", [Other2]),
 2065: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, on, econnreset, Other2})
 2066:     after 1000 ->
 2067:             ?P("UNEXPECTED timeout (expected error:econnreset)"),
 2068:             ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_error}})
 2069:     end.
 2070: 
 2071: show_econnreset_active_once(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2072:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2073:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2074:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2075:                             Addr;
 2076:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2077:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2078:                     end
 2079:            end,
 2080:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_active_once(Config, Addr) end,
 2081:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2082:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 2083: 
 2084: do_show_econnreset_active_once(Config, Addr) ->
 2085:     %% Now test using {active, once}
 2086:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0,
 2087:                       [{active, false},
 2088:                        {show_econnreset, true},
 2089:                        {ip, Addr}]),

 2092:                            [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of

 2094:                      CSock;
 2095:                   {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 2096:                       ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 2097:               end,
 2098:     {ok, S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 2099:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2100:     ok = inet:setopts(Client, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2101:     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client),
 2102:     ok = ct:sleep(20),
 2103:     ok = receive Msg -> {unexpected_msg, Msg} after 0 -> ok end,
 2104:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{active, once}]),

 2106: 	{tcp_error, S, econnreset} ->
 2107: 	    receive
 2108: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 2109: 		    ok;
 2110: 		Other1 ->
 2111: 		    ct:fail({unexpected1, Other1})
 2112: 	    after 1 ->
 2113: 		ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_closed}})
 2114: 	    end;
 2115: 	Other2 ->
 2116: 	    ct:fail({unexpected2, Other2})
 2117:     after 1000 ->
 2118: 	ct:fail({timeout, {server, no_tcp_error}})
 2119:     end.

 2121: show_econnreset_passive(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2122:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 2123:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 2124:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 2125:                             Addr;
 2126:                         {error, Reason} ->
 2127:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 2128:                     end
 2129:            end,
 2130:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_show_econnreset_passive(Config, Addr) end,
 2131:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 2132:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).

 2134: do_show_econnreset_passive(Config, Addr) ->
 2135:     %% First confirm everything works with option turned off.
 2136:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2137:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 2138:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]) of
 2139:                  {ok, CSock} ->
 2140:                      CSock;
 2141:                  {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason} ->
 2142:                      ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason))
 2143:              end,
 2144:     {ok, S} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 2145:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 2146:     ok = inet:setopts(S, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2147:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S),
 2148:     ok = ct:sleep(1),
 2149:     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Client, 0),
 2150: 
 2151:     %% Now test with option switched on.
 2152:     {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]),

 2154:     Client1 =
 2155:         case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port1,
 2156:                       [{active,          false},
 2157:                        {show_econnreset, true},
 2158:                        {ip,              Addr}]) of
 2159:             {ok, CSock1} ->
 2160:                 CSock1;
 2161:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2162:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2163:         end,            
 2164:     {ok, S1} = gen_tcp:accept(L1),
 2165:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),
 2166:     ok = inet:setopts(S1, [{linger, {true, 0}}]),
 2167:     ok = gen_tcp:close(S1),

 2169:     {error, econnreset} = gen_tcp:recv(Client1, 0),
 2170:     ?P("done"),
 2171:     ok.

 2186: do_econnreset_after_sync_send(Config, Addr) ->
 2187:     %% First confirm everything works with option turned off.

 2190:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L),
 2191:     Client = case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port,

 2195:                  {ok, CSock} ->

 2201:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),

 2206:     %% {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(Client, "Whatever"),
 2207:     ok = ecr_ass_send(Config, Client, closed),
 2208:     %% _ = inet:setopts(Client, [{debug, false}]),
 2209: 
 2210:     %% Now test with option switched on.
 2211:     ?P("test with option explicitly switched on"),
 2212:     {ok, L1}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{active, false}, {ip, Addr}]),
 2213:     {ok, Port1} = inet:port(L1),
 2214:     Client1 =
 2215:         case ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, Port1,
 2216:                       [{active,          false},
 2217:                        {show_econnreset, true},
 2218:                        {ip,              Addr}]) of
 2219:             {ok, CSock1} ->
 2220:                 CSock1;
 2221:             {error, eaddrnotavail = Reason1} ->
 2222:                 ?SKIPT(connect_failed_str(Reason1))
 2223:         end,

 2225:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L1),

 2235: ecr_ass_send(Config, Sock, Expected) ->
 2236:     case os:type() of
 2237: 	{win32, nt} ->
 2238: 	    case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 2239: 		true ->
 2240: 		    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, 2);
 2241: 		false ->
 2242: 		    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, 1)
 2243: 	    end;
 2244: 	_ ->
 2245: 	    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, 1)
 2246:     end.
 2247: 
 2248: do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, N) when (N > 0) ->
 2249:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, "Whatever") of
 2250: 	{error, Expected} ->
 2251: 	    ?P("[~w] expected send result", [N]),
 2252: 	    ok;
 2253: 	{error, Unexpected} ->
 2254: 	    ?P("[~w] unexpected send error: "
 2255: 	       "~n   Expected:   ~p"
 2256: 	       "~n   Unexpected: ~p", [N, Expected, Unexpected]),
 2257: 	    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, N-1);
 2258: 	ok ->
 2259: 	    ?P("[~w] unexpected send success", [N]),
 2260: 	    do_ecr_ass_send(Sock, Expected, N-1)
 2261:     end;
 2262: do_ecr_ass_send(_Sock, _Expected, _) ->
 2263:     error.
