 8207: otp_13939(doc) ->
 8208:     ["Check that writing to a remotely closed socket doesn't block forever "
 8209:      "when exit_on_close is false."];
 8210: otp_13939(suite) ->
 8211:     [];
 8212: otp_13939(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8213:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_opt(
 8214:         fun() ->
 8215:             {ok, Listener} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{exit_on_close, false}]),
 8216:             {ok, Port} = inet:port(Listener),
 8217: 
 8218:             spawn_link(
 8219:                 fun() ->
 8220:                     {ok, Client} = ?CONNECT(Config, "localhost", Port,
 8221:                         [{active, false}]),
 8222:                     ok = gen_tcp:close(Client)
 8223:                 end),
 8224: 
 8225:             {ok, Accepted} = gen_tcp:accept(Listener),
 8226: 
 8227:             ok = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8228: 
 8229:             %% The bug surfaces when there's a delay between the send
 8230:             %% operations; inet:getstat is a red herring.
 8231:             timer:sleep(100),
 8232: 
 8233:             {error, Code} = gen_tcp:send(Accepted, <<0:(10*1024*1024*8)>>),
 8234:             ct:pal("gen_tcp:send returned ~p~n", [Code])
 8235:         end, [link, monitor]),
 8236: 
 8237:     receive
 8238:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} ->
 8239:             ok
 8240:     after 1000 ->
 8241:         demonitor(Ref, [flush]),
 8242:         exit(Pid, normal),
 8243:         ct:fail("Server process blocked on send.")
 8244:     end.
 8245: 
 8246: 
 8247: %% No point in running this as the test case with inet_backend = socket
 8248: %% as it tests a bug in the inet driver that cannot reproduced with
 8249: %% inet_backend = socket.
 8250: otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8251:     Cond = fun() ->
 8252: 		   case os:type() of
 8253: 		       {win32,_} ->
 8254: 			   %% Even if we set sndbuf and recbuf to small sizes
 8255: 			   %% Windows either happily accepts to send GBytes of
 8256: 			   %% data in no time, so the second send below that
 8257: 			   %% is supposed to time out just succeeds, or the 
 8258: 			   %% first send that is supposed to fill the inet_drv
 8259: 			   %% I/O queue and start waiting for when more data
 8260: 			   %% can be sent instead sends all data but suffers
 8261: 			   %% a send failure that closes the socket.
 8262: 			   {skip, backpressure_broken_on_win32};
 8263: 		       _ ->
 8264: 			   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8265: 			       true ->
 8266: 				   {skip, "Not compliant with socket"};
 8267: 			       false ->
 8268: 				   ok
 8269: 			   end
 8270: 		   end
 8271: 	   end,
 8272:     TC = fun() -> do_otp_12242(Config) end,
 8273:     ?TC_TRY(otp_12242, Cond, TC).
 8274: 
 8275: do_otp_12242(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8276:     %% Find the IPv4 address of an up and running interface
 8277:     %% that is not loopback nor pointtopoint
 8278:     {ok, IFList} = inet:getifaddrs(),
 8279:     ?P("IFList "
 8280:        "~n      ~p", [IFList]),
 8281:     case
 8282: 	lists:flatten(
 8283: 	  [lists:filtermap(
 8284: 	     fun ({addr, Addr}) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8285: 		     {true, Addr};
 8286: 		 (_) ->
 8287: 		     false
 8288: 	     end, Opts)
 8289: 	   || {_,Opts} <- IFList,
 8290: 	      case lists:keyfind(flags, 1, Opts) of
 8291: 		  {_,Flags} ->
 8292: 		      lists:member(up, Flags)
 8293: 			  andalso
 8294: 			  lists:member(running, Flags)
 8295: 			  andalso
 8296: 			  not lists:member(loopback, Flags)
 8297: 			  andalso
 8298: 			  not lists:member(pointtopoint, Flags);
 8299: 		  false ->
 8300: 		      false
 8301: 	      end])
 8302:     of
 8303: 	[Addr|_] ->
 8304: 	    otp_12242(Config, Addr);
 8305: 	Other ->
 8306: 	    ?SKIPT({no_external_address, Other})
 8307:     end.
 8308: 
 8309: %%
 8310: otp_12242(Config, Addr) when (tuple_size(Addr) =:= 4) ->
 8311:     ct:timetrap(30000),
 8312:     ?P("Using address ~p", [Addr]),
 8313:     Bufsize  = 16 * 1024,
 8314:     Datasize = 128 * 1024 * 1024, % At least 1 s on GBit interface
 8315:     Blob     = binary:copy(<<$x>>, Datasize),
 8316:     LOpts =
 8317:         [{backlog,   4},
 8318: 	 {reuseaddr, true},
 8319: 	 {ip,        Addr},
 8320:          binary,
 8321: 	 {active,    false},
 8322:          {recbuf,    Bufsize},
 8323: 	 {sndbuf,    Bufsize},
 8324: 	 {buffer,    Bufsize}],
 8325:     COpts =
 8326:         [binary,
 8327: 	 {active,       false},
 8328: 	 {ip,           Addr},
 8329:          {linger,       {true, 1}}, % 1 s
 8330:          {send_timeout, 500},
 8331:          {recbuf,       Bufsize},
 8332: 	 {sndbuf,       Bufsize},
 8333: 	 {buffer,       Bufsize}],
 8334:     Dir = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 8335:     {ok, ListenerNode} = ?START_NODE(?UNIQ_NODE_NAME, "-pa " ++ Dir),
 8336:     Tester = self(),
 8337:     ?P("create listener"),
 8338:     {Listener, ListenerMRef} =
 8339:         spawn_opt(
 8340:           ListenerNode,
 8341:           fun () ->
 8342: 		  ?P("create listen socket"),
 8343:                   {ok,L}     = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, LOpts),
 8344:                   {ok,LPort} = inet:port(L),
 8345: 		  ?P("inform tester about port number: ~w", [LPort]),
 8346:                   Tester ! {self(), port, LPort},
 8347: 		  ?P("try accept"),
 8348:                   {ok, A}    = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8349: 		  ?P("accepted - close listen socket"),
 8350:                   ok         = gen_tcp:close(L),
 8351: 		  ?P("await close order"),
 8352:                   receive
 8353:                       {Tester, stop} ->
 8354: 			  ?P("close order received - close accepted socket"),
 8355:                           ok = gen_tcp:close(A)
 8356:                   end
 8357:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8358:     ?P("await listen port"),
 8359:     LPort = receive {Listener,port,P} -> P end,
 8360:     ?P("try connect to ~w", [LPort]),
 8361:     {ok,C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, LPort, COpts, infinity),
 8362:     ?P("connected - get buffers"),
 8363:     {ok, ReadCOpts} = inet:getopts(C, [recbuf,sndbuf,buffer]),
 8364:     ?P("connected sockets buffers:"
 8365:        "~n      ~p", [ReadCOpts]),
 8366: 
 8367:     otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize),
 8368: 
 8369:     ?P("send listener stop"),
 8370:     Listener ! {Tester, stop},
 8371:     ?P("await listener termination"),
 8372:     wait(ListenerMRef),
 8373:     ?P("stop listener node"),
 8374:     ?STOP_NODE(ListenerNode),
 8375:     ?P("done"),
 8376:     ok.
 8377:     
 8378: 
 8379: otp_12242_2(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8380:     %% Fill the buffers
 8381:     ?P("sending ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8382:     case gen_tcp:send(C, Blob) of
 8383:         ok ->
 8384:             ?P("sent ~p bytes", [Datasize]),
 8385:             otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize);
 8386:         {error, {timeout, _RestData}} ->
 8387:             %% We filled the buffers and timed out;
 8388:             %% this is probably the socket backend - give up.
 8389:             ok;
 8390:         {error, timeout} ->
 8391:             %% The same as the previous clause
 8392:             ok
 8393:     end,
 8394:     _ = gen_tcp:close(C),
 8395:     ok.
 8396: 
 8397: otp_12242_3(C, Blob, Datasize) ->
 8398:     %% Try to ensure that the close call is in progress
 8399:     %% before the owner proceeds with sending
 8400:     CloserMRef = otp_12242_closer(C),
 8401:     
 8402:     ?P("await tref"),
 8403:     receive
 8404:         {tref,Tref} ->
 8405: 	    ?P("tref received - now await trigger timeout"),
 8406:             receive {timeout,Tref,_} -> ok end,
 8407:             ?P("trigger timeout received - try send ~p bytes again",
 8408: 	       [Datasize]),
 8409:             %% Now should the close be in progress...
 8410:             %% All buffers are full, remote end is not reading,
 8411:             %% and the send timeout is 1 s so this will timeout:
 8412:             {error, timeout} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8413:             ?P("expected timeout - update send_timeout (to 10000)"),
 8414:             ok = inet:setopts(C, [{send_timeout, 10000}]),
 8415:             %% There is a hidden timeout here.  Port close is sampled
 8416:             %% every 5 s by prim_inet:send_recv_reply.
 8417:             %% Linger is 3 s so the Closer will finish this send:
 8418:             ?P("try send ~p bytes - expect error (closed)", [Datasize]),
 8419:             {error, closed} = gen_tcp:send(C, Blob),
 8420:             ?P("await closer termination"),
 8421:             normal = wait(CloserMRef),
 8422:             ok
 8423:     end.
 8424: 
 8425: otp_12242_closer(C) ->
 8426:     Owner = self(),
 8427:     {_Closer, CloserMref} =
 8428:         spawn_opt(
 8429:           fun () ->
 8430:                   ?P("[closer] starting"),
 8431:                   Owner ! {tref, erlang:start_timer(50, Owner, closing)},
 8432:                   ?P("[closer] calling gen_tcp:close(C)"),
 8433:                   try gen_tcp:close(C) of
 8434:                       Result ->
 8435:                           ?P("[closer] gen_tcp:close(C) -> ~p", [Result]),
 8436:                           ok = Result
 8437:                   catch
 8438:                       Class:Reason:Stacktrace ->
 8439:                           ?P("[closer] caught gen_tcp:close(C):"
 8440: 			     "~n      Error Class:  ~p"
 8441: 			     "~n      Error:        ~p"
 8442: 			     "~n      Stack trace:  ~p",
 8443:                             [Class, Reason, Stacktrace]),
 8444:                           erlang:raise(Class, Reason, Stacktrace)
 8445:                   end
 8446:           end, [link, monitor]),
 8447:     CloserMref.
 8448: 
 8449: 
 8450: wait(Mref) ->
 8451:     receive {'DOWN',Mref,_,_,Reason} -> Reason end.
 8452: 
 8453: %% OTP-15536
 8454: %% Test that send error works correctly for delay_send
 8455: delay_send_error(Config) ->
 8456:     ?P("create listen socket"),
 8457:     {ok, Addr} = ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet),
 8458:     {ok, L}    = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip,        Addr},
 8459:                                      {reuseaddr, true},
 8460:                                      {packet,    1},
 8461:                                      {active,    false}]),
 8462:     {ok, {_, PortNum}} = inet:sockname(L),
 8463: 
 8464:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, false),
 8465:     delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, true),
 8466:     ?P("close listen socket"),
 8467:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L).
 8468: 
 8469: delay_send_error(Config, L, Addr, PortNum, Active) ->
 8470:     ?P("try connect - with delay_send:true active:~p",[Active]),
 8471:     {ok, C} = ?CONNECT(Config, Addr, PortNum,
 8472:                        [{ip,         Addr},
 8473:                         {packet,     1},
 8474:                         {active,     Active},
 8475:                         {delay_send, true}]),
 8476:     ?P("try accept"),
 8477:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 8478:     %% Do a couple of sends first to see that it works
 8479:     ?P("send data"),
 8480:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8481:     ?P("send data"),
 8482:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8483:     ?P("send data"),
 8484:     ok = gen_tcp:send(C, "hello"),
 8485:     %% Close the receiver
 8486:     ?P("close receiver (accepted socket)"),
 8487:     ok = gen_tcp:shutdown(C, write),
 8488:     %%
 8489:     ?P("send data"),
 8490:     case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8491:         ok ->
 8492:             ?P("send data"),
 8493:             case gen_tcp:send(C, "hello") of
 8494:                 ok ->
 8495:                     delay_send_error2(C);
 8496:                 {error, closed} ->
 8497:                     ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8498:                     ok
 8499:             end;
 8500: 
 8501:         {error, closed} ->
 8502:             ?P("closed (expected)"),
 8503:             ok;
 8504: 
 8505:         {error, #{info := eshutdown = R}} ->
 8506:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8507:             ok;
 8508:         {error, eshutdown = R} ->
 8509:             ?P("~w (expected)", [R]),
 8510:             ok
 8511:     end,
 8512:     ?P("close accepted socket"),
 8513:     ok = gen_tcp:close(A),
 8514:     ?P("close connected socket"),
 8515:     ok = gen_tcp:close(C).
 8516: 
 8517: 
 8518: delay_send_error2(Sock) ->
 8519:     delay_send_error2(Sock, 3).
 8520: 
 8521: delay_send_error2(Sock, 0) ->
 8522:     gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 8523:     ct:fail("Unexpected send success");
 8524: delay_send_error2(Sock, N) ->
 8525:     %% Sleep in order for delay_send to have time to trigger
 8526:     %% This used to result in a double free
 8527:     timer:sleep(1000),
 8528:     case gen_tcp:send(Sock, "hello") of
 8529:         ok ->
 8530:             delay_send_error2(Sock, N-1);
 8531:         {error, closed} ->
 8532:             ?P("closed (expected, ~w)", [N]),
 8533:             ok;
 8534:         {error, Reason} ->
 8535:             ct:fail(?F("Unexpected send error: ~p", [Reason]))
 8536:     end.
 8537:

 8541: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8542: 
 8543: 
 8544: -define(MAX_WORKERS, 30).
 8545: 
 8546: %% 30-second test for gen_tcp in {active, N} mode,
 8547: %% ensuring it does not get stuck.
 8548: %% Verifies that erl_check_io properly handles extra EPOLLIN signals.
 8549: %% We do not bother with this test case on inet_backend = socket
 8550: %% since the test is about the inet-driver!
 8551: bidirectional_traffic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8552:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 8553:     Cond = fun() ->
 8554: 		   case ?IS_SOCKET_BACKEND(Config) of
 8555: 		       true ->
 8556: 			   {skip, "Inet driver specific test"};
 8557: 		       false ->
 8558:                            %% Unstable on our Solaris/SunOS machine(s)
 8559:                            is_not_sunos(),
 8560: 			   ok
 8561: 		   end
 8562: 	   end,
 8563:     Pre  = fun() ->
 8564: 		   Addr =
 8565: 		       case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8566: 			   {ok, A} ->
 8567: 			       A;
 8568: 			   {error, Reason} ->
 8569: 			       ?SKIPT({skip, Reason})
 8570: 		       end,
 8571:                    NumOnlineScheds = erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 8572:                    NumWorkers0     = NumOnlineScheds * 2,
 8573:                    {NumWorkers, ActiveN} =
 8574:                        if
 8575:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 10) ->
 8576:                                {NumWorkers0, 20};
 8577:                            (NumWorkers0 =< 20) ->
 8578:                                {NumWorkers0, 18};
 8579:                            (NumWorkers0 =< ?MAX_WORKERS) ->
 8580:                                {NumWorkers0, 15};
 8581:                            true ->
 8582:                                {?MAX_WORKERS, 15}
 8583:                        end,
 8584:                    ?P("pre ->"
 8585:                       "~n   Number Of Online Schedulers: ~w"
 8586:                       "~n   =>"
 8587:                       "~n      Use workers: ~w"
 8588:                       "~n      ActiveN:     ~w",
 8589:                       [NumOnlineScheds, NumWorkers, ActiveN]),
 8590:                    Payload = bdt_payload(32),
 8591:                    {ok, LSock} = ?LISTEN(Config,
 8592:                                          0,
 8593:                                          [binary,
 8594:                                           {ip,        Addr},
 8595: 					  {packet,    0},
 8596:                                           {active,    false},
 8597:                                           {reuseaddr, true}]),
 8598:                    %% get all sockets to know failing ends
 8599:                    ?P("pre -> listen socket created: "
 8600:                       "~n      ~p", [LSock]),
 8601:                    #{lsock       => LSock,
 8602: 		     addr        => Addr,
 8603:                      num_workers => NumWorkers,
 8604:                      payload     => Payload,
 8605:                      %% The point of this is to make it "easy" to 
 8606:                      %% "configure" this value...
 8607:                      active_n    => ActiveN}
 8608:            end,
 8609:     Case = fun(Info) -> do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, Info) end,
 8610:     Post = fun(#{lsock := LSock}) ->
 8611:                    ?P("post -> close listen socket"),
 8612:                    (catch gen_tcp:close(LSock))
 8613:            end,
 8614:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 8615:             Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 8616: 
 8617: bdt_payload(N) ->
 8618:     rand:bytes(N).
 8619:     
 8620: 
 8621: do_bidirectional_traffic(Config, #{lsock       := LSock,
 8622:                                    num_workers := NumWorkers} = Info) ->
 8623:     ?P("case -> begin"),
 8624:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(LSock),
 8625:     ?P("case -> listen socket port number ~w", [Port]),
 8626:     Control = self(),
 8627:     ?P("case -> create ~w receivers", [NumWorkers]),
 8628:     Receivers = [spawn_link(fun () ->
 8629:                                     erlang:process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 8630: 				    exchange(Config,
 8631:                                              Info#{port => Port,
 8632:                                                    ctrl => Control})
 8633: 			    end) || _ <- lists:seq(1, NumWorkers)],
 8634:     ?P("case -> await the result"),
 8635:     %% Should we not collect as many as possible?
 8636:     %% To see how many as issues?
 8637:     Result =
 8638: 	%% If any of the receivers report, we have an error
 8639:         receive
 8640:             {timeout, Socket, Total} ->
 8641:                 ?P("case -> timeout msg for ~p: received ~w", [Socket, Total]),
 8642:                 throw({fail, {timeout, Socket, Total}});
 8643: 	    {error, Socket, Reason} ->
 8644:                 ?P("case -> error msg for ~p: ~p", [Socket, Reason]),
 8645:                 throw({fail, {error, Socket, Reason}})
 8646:         after 30000 ->
 8647:                 %% if it does not fail in 30 seconds, it most likely works
 8648:                 ?P("case -> timeout => success"),
 8649:                 ok
 8650:         end,
 8651:     ?P("case -> ensure all receivers terminated"),
 8652:     %% [begin unlink(Rec), exit(Rec, kill) end || Rec <- Receivers],
 8653:     bt_terminate_receivers(Receivers),
 8654:     ?P("case -> done"),
 8655:     Result.
 8656: 
 8657: %% The point of this (function) is so that the 'receivers' should
 8658: %% get a chance to "tell us" what they are up to...
 8659: bt_terminate_receivers(Recvs) ->
 8660:     bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs),
 8661:     ?SLEEP(?SECS(5)),
 8662:     bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs).
 8663: 
 8664: bt_terminate_receivers_nice(Recvs) ->
 8665:     [begin
 8666:          unlink(Recv),
 8667:          Recv ! terminate
 8668:      end || Recv <- Recvs].
 8669: 
 8670: bt_terminate_receivers_force(Recvs) ->
 8671:     [exit(Recv, kill) || Recv <- Recvs].
 8672:     
 8673: exchange(Config, #{lsock    := LSock,
 8674: 		   addr     := Addr,
 8675:                    port     := Port, 
 8676:                    payload  := Payload,
 8677:                    ctrl     := Control,
 8678:                    active_n := ActiveN}) ->
 8679:     %% spin up client
 8680:     ClientRcv =
 8681:         spawn_link(
 8682:           fun () ->
 8683:                   erlang:process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 8684:                   ?P("exchange:client -> connect"),
 8685:                   {ok, Client} =
 8686:                       ?CONNECT(Config,
 8687:                                Addr,
 8688:                                Port,
 8689:                                [binary,
 8690:                                 {ip, Addr}, {packet, 0}, {active, ActiveN}]),
 8691:                   ?P("exchange:client -> connected: ~p"
 8692:                      "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8693:                      "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8694:                      [Client,
 8695:                       oki(inet:peername(Client)), oki(inet:sockname(Client))]),
 8696:                   put(role, connected),
 8697:                   send_recv_loop(undefined,
 8698:                                  Client, Payload, Control, ActiveN)
 8699:           end),
 8700:     ?P("exchange -> accept"),
 8701:     {ok, Socket} = gen_tcp:accept(LSock),
 8702:     ?P("exchange -> accepted: ~p"
 8703:        "~n      PeerName: ~p"
 8704:        "~n      SockName: ~p",
 8705:        [Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket))]),
 8706:     %% sending process
 8707:     put(role, accepted),
 8708:     send_recv_loop(ClientRcv,
 8709:                    Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN).
 8710: 
 8711: %% ClientPid: pid() | undefined
 8712: send_recv_loop(ClientPid,
 8713:                Socket, Payload, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8714:     %% {active, N} must be set to active > 12 to trigger the issue
 8715:     %% {active, 30} seems to trigger it quite often & reliably
 8716:     Role = get(role),
 8717:     ?P("[~w] set (initial) active: ~p", [Role, ActiveN]),
 8718:     inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8719:     ?P("[~w] spawn sender", [Role]),
 8720:     SenderPid = spawn_link(
 8721:         fun Sender() ->
 8722:             case gen_tcp:send(Socket, Payload) of
 8723:                 ok ->
 8724:                     Sender();
 8725:                 {error, closed} ->
 8726:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Socket closed", [Role]),
 8727:                     exit(normal);
 8728: 
 8729:                 %% This happens at least for connected sender
 8730:                 {error, einval = Reason} ->
 8731:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Send failed: "
 8732:                        "~n      Reason: ~p"
 8733:                        "~n      Links:  ~p", [Role, Reason, links()]),
 8734:                     exit(normal);
 8735: 
 8736:                 {error, Reason} ->
 8737:                     ?P("[~w,sender] Send failed: "
 8738:                        "~n      Reason: ~p"
 8739:                        "~n      Links:  ~p", [Role, Reason, links()]),
 8740:                     exit({send_failed, Reason})
 8741:             end
 8742:         end),
 8743:     ?P("[~w] begin recv when"
 8744:        "~n   Sender: ~p"
 8745:        "~n   Links:  ~p", [Role, SenderPid, links()]),
 8746:     recv(ClientPid, SenderPid,
 8747:          Socket, 0, 0, 0, Control, ActiveN).
 8748: 
 8749: recv(ClientPid, SenderPid,
 8750:      Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct, Control, ActiveN) ->
 8751:     receive
 8752:         terminate ->
 8753:             ?P("[~w,recv] received terminate message when"
 8754:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8755:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8756:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8757:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8758:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8759:                [get(role),
 8760:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8761:                 Socket, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8762:             maybe_stop_client(ClientPid),
 8763:             ?P("~w[~w,recv] -> close socket", [?FUNCTION_NAME, get(role)]),
 8764:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8765:             await_sender_exit(SenderPid),
 8766:             exit(normal);
 8767: 
 8768:         {tcp, Socket, Data} ->
 8769:             recv(ClientPid, SenderPid,
 8770:                  Socket,
 8771:                  Total + byte_size(Data), TotIter + 1, TotAct,
 8772:                  Control, ActiveN);
 8773:         {tcp_passive, Socket} ->
 8774:             inet:setopts(Socket, [{active, ActiveN}]),
 8775:             recv(ClientPid, SenderPid,
 8776:                  Socket, Total, TotIter, TotAct + 1, Control, ActiveN);
 8777:         {tcp_closed, Socket} ->
 8778:             ?P("[~w,recv] closed when"
 8779:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8780:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8781:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8782:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8783: 	       [get(role), Total, TotIter, TotAct, (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8784: 	    ok;
 8785: 
 8786:         %% It is a race if this message is received before the tcp_closed
 8787:         %% since we are now linked with the client process...
 8788:         {'EXIT', ClientPid, normal} ->
 8789:             ?P("[~w,recv] received (normal) exit message from client"
 8790:                "~n   when:"
 8791:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8792:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8793:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8794:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8795:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8796:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8797:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8798:                [get(role),
 8799:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8800:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8801:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8802:             recv(undefined, SenderPid,
 8803:                  Socket,
 8804:                  Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8805:                  Control, ActiveN);
 8806: 
 8807:         Other ->
 8808:             ?P("[~w,recv] received unexpected message"
 8809:                "~n      Msg:               ~p"
 8810:                "~n   when:"
 8811:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8812:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8813:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8814:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8815:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8816:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8817:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8818:                [get(role),
 8819:                 Other,
 8820:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8821:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8822:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8823:             maybe_stop_client(ClientPid),
 8824:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8825:             await_sender_exit(SenderPid),
 8826:             Control ! {error, Socket, Other}
 8827: 
 8828:     after 2000 ->
 8829:             %% no data received in 2 seconds => test failed
 8830:             ?P("[~w,recv timeout] received nothing when:"
 8831:                "~n      Total received:    ~w"
 8832:                "~n      Total iterations:  ~w"
 8833:                "~n      Total activations: ~w"
 8834:                "~n      Socket:            ~p"
 8835:                "~n      PeerName:          ~p"
 8836:                "~n      SockName:          ~p"
 8837:                "~n      Socket Info:       ~p",
 8838:                [get(role),
 8839:                 Total, TotIter, TotAct,
 8840:                 Socket, oki(inet:peername(Socket)), oki(inet:sockname(Socket)),
 8841:                 (catch inet:info(Socket))]),
 8842:             maybe_stop_client(ClientPid),
 8843:             (catch gen_tcp:close(Socket)),
 8844:             await_sender_exit(SenderPid),
 8845:             Control ! {timeout, Socket, Total}
 8846:     end.
 8847: 
 8848: %% The accepted (send and recv) process has a pid.
 8849: %% But the connected (client) process does not.
 8850: maybe_stop_client(ClientPid) when is_pid(ClientPid) ->
 8851:     ?P("~w -> forward terminate to client process ~p",
 8852:        [?FUNCTION_NAME, ClientPid]),
 8853:     ClientPid ! terminate,
 8854:     receive
 8855:         {'EXIT', ClientPid, _} ->
 8856:             ?P("~w -> received exit signal from client process ~p",
 8857:                [?FUNCTION_NAME, ClientPid]),
 8858:             ok
 8859:     after 2000 ->
 8860:             %% We need to give the client time to wait for *its*
 8861:             %% sender to terminate (therefor 2000 here).
 8862:             ?P("~w -> client process ~p did not die in time - give up"
 8863:                "~n   Info:  ~p"
 8864:                "~n   Links: ~p",
 8865:                [?FUNCTION_NAME, ClientPid, pi(ClientPid), links()]),
 8866:             ok
 8867:     end;
 8868: maybe_stop_client(_) ->
 8869:     ok.
 8870: 
 8871: await_sender_exit(SenderPid) ->
 8872:     ?P("~w[~w,recv] -> await sender (~p) exit when"
 8873:        "~n   Links: ~p",
 8874:        [?FUNCTION_NAME, get(role), SenderPid, links()]),
 8875:     receive
 8876:         {'EXIT', SenderPid, _Reason} ->
 8877:             ?P("~w -> received exit signal from sender process ~p",
 8878:                [?FUNCTION_NAME, SenderPid]),
 8879:             ok
 8880:     after 1000 ->
 8881:             ?P("~w -> sender process ~p did not die in time - give up"
 8882:                "~n   Info:  ~p"
 8883:                "~n   Links: ~p",
 8884:                [?FUNCTION_NAME, SenderPid, pi(SenderPid), links()]),
 8885:             ok
 8886:     end.
 8887:

 8889: 
 8890: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8891: 
 8892: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8893: %% We create a listen socket, then spawns processes that create
 8894: %% monitors to it...
 8895: socket_monitor1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8896:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8897:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8898:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8899:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8900:                             Addr;
 8901:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8902:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8903:                     end
 8904:            end,
 8905:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) end,
 8906:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8907:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8908: 
 8909: do_socket_monitor1(Config, Addr) ->
 8910:     ?P("begin"),
 8911:     Self         = self(),
 8912:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8913:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8914:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 8915:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 8916: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 8917: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 8918: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 8919: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 8920: 	 end,
 8921:     ?P("spawn client"),
 8922:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 8923:     ?P("await client ready"),
 8924:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 8925:     ?P("close socket"),
 8926:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 8927:     ?P("await client termination"),
 8928:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 8929:     ?P("done"),
 8930:     ok.
 8931: 
 8932: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 8933:     sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 8934: 
 8935: sm_await_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 8936:     receive
 8937: 	{'DOWN', ExpMon, ExpType, ExpSock, _Info} = Msg ->
 8938: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 8939: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Msg]),
 8940: 	    exit(ok);
 8941: 
 8942: 	Any ->
 8943:             ExpMsg = {'DOWN', ExpMon, ExpType, ExpSock, '_Info'},
 8944: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 8945: 	       "~n   ~p, Expected:"
 8946:                "~n   ~p", [Name, Any, ExpMsg]),
 8947: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any, ExpMsg})
 8948:     end.
 8949: 
 8950: sm_await_client_ready(Pid) ->
 8951:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid, "client").
 8952: 
 8953: sm_await_client_ready(Pid, Name) ->
 8954:     receive
 8955: 	{Pid, ready} ->
 8956: 	    ?P("received ~s ready", [Name])
 8957:     end.
 8958: 
 8959: sm_await_down(Pid, Mon, ExpRes) ->
 8960:     receive
 8961: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, ExpRes} ->
 8962: 	    ?P("received expected process down message from ~p", [Pid]),
 8963: 	    ok;
 8964: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, UnexpRes} ->
 8965: 	    ?P("received unexpected process down message from ~p: "
 8966: 	       "~n   ~p, Expected:"
 8967:                "~n   ~p", [Pid, UnexpRes, ExpRes]),
 8968: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_down, UnexpRes, ExpRes})
 8969:     end.
 8970:

 8972: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 8973: 
 8974: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 8975: %% We create "many" listen socket(s), then spawns processes that create
 8976: %% monitors to them...
 8977: socket_monitor1_manys(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 8978:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 8979:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 8980:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 8981:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 8982:                             Addr;
 8983:                         {error, Reason} ->
 8984:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 8985:                     end
 8986:            end,
 8987:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) end,
 8988:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 8989:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 8990: 
 8991: do_socket_monitor1_manys(Config, Addr) ->
 8992:     ?P("begin"),
 8993:     Self         = self(),
 8994:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 8995:     ?P("[client] create socket(s)"),
 8996:     {ok, LSock1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8997:     {ok, LSock2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8998:     {ok, LSock3} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 8999:     {ok, LSock4} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9000:     {ok, LSock5} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9001:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 9002:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->
 9003: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor(s)"),
 9004: 		 Monitors = [{inet:monitor(Socket), Socket} ||
 9005: 				Socket <- Sockets],
 9006: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9007: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 9008: 	 end,
 9009:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9010:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F([LSock1, LSock2, LSock3, LSock4, LSock5], F1),
 9011:     ?P("await client ready"),
 9012:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9013:     ?P("close socket(s)"),
 9014:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 9015:     gen_tcp:close(LSock2),
 9016:     gen_tcp:close(LSock3),
 9017:     gen_tcp:close(LSock4),
 9018:     gen_tcp:close(LSock5),
 9019:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9020:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9021:     ?P("done"),
 9022:     ok.
 9023: 
 9024: 
 9025: sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType) ->
 9026:     sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, ExpType, "client").
 9027: 
 9028: sm_await_socket_down2([], _ExpType, Name) ->
 9029:     ?P("[~s] all sockets down", [Name]),
 9030:     exit(ok);
 9031: sm_await_socket_down2(Mons, ExpType, Name) when is_list(Mons) ->
 9032:     ?P("[~s] await socket down", [Name]),
 9033:     receive
 9034: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) ->
 9035: 	    ?P("[~s] received expected (socket) down message: "
 9036: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 9037: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 9038: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 9039: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 9040: 	    case lists:keysearch(Mon, 1, Mons) of
 9041: 		{value, {Mon, Sock}} ->
 9042: 		    Mons2 = lists:keydelete(Mon, 1, Mons),
 9043: 		    sm_await_socket_down2(Mons2, ExpType, Name);
 9044: 		{value, Value} ->
 9045: 		    ?P("[~s] Unexpected socket down: "
 9046: 		       "~n   Value: ~p", [Name, Value]),
 9047: 		    ct:fail({unexpected_monitor, Mon, Value});
 9048: 		false ->
 9049: 		    ct:fail({unknown_monitor, Mon})
 9050: 	    end
 9051:     end.
 9052:

 9099:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid5, "client5"),
 9100:     ?P("close socket"),
 9101:     gen_tcp:close(LSock1),
 9102:     ?P("await client(s) termination"),
 9103:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9104:     sm_await_down(Pid2, Mon2, ok),
 9105:     sm_await_down(Pid3, Mon3, ok),
 9106:     sm_await_down(Pid4, Mon4, ok),
 9107:     sm_await_down(Pid5, Mon5, ok),

 9160: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType) ->
 9161:     sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, "client").
 9162: 
 9163: sm_await_no_socket_down(ExpMon, ExpSock, ExpType, Name) ->
 9164:     receive
 9165: 	{'DOWN', Mon, Type, Sock, Info} when (Type =:= ExpType) andalso 
 9166: 					     (Mon  =:= ExpMon)  andalso 
 9167: 					     (Sock =:= ExpSock) ->
 9168: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected (socket) down message: "
 9169: 	       "~n   Mon:  ~p"
 9170: 	       "~n   Type: ~p"
 9171: 	       "~n   Sock: ~p"
 9172: 	       "~n   Info: ~p", [Name, Mon, Type, Sock, Info]),
 9173: 	    exit({unexpected_down, Mon, Type, Sock, Info});
 9174: 
 9175: 	Any ->
 9176: 	    ?P("[~s] received unexpected message: "
 9177: 	       "~n   ~p", [Name, Any]),
 9178: 	    exit({unexpected_message, Any})
 9179: 
 9180:     after 1000 ->
 9181: 	    ?P("[~s] expected message timeout", [Name]),
 9182: 	    exit(ok)
 9183:     end.

 9190: %% that create monitors to it...
 9191: socket_monitor2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9192:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9193:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9194:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9195:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9196:                             Addr;
 9197:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9198:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9199:                     end
 9200:            end,
 9201:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) end,
 9202:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9203:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9204: 
 9205: do_socket_monitor2(Config, Addr) ->
 9206:     ?P("begin"),
 9207:     Type         = ?SOCKET_TYPE(Config),
 9208:     Self         = self(),
 9209:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9210: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9211: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket"),
 9212: 			      {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9213: 			      ?P("[owner] send (listen) socket to ctrl"),
 9214: 			      Self ! {socket, L},
 9215: 			      ?P("[owner] ready"),
 9216: 			      receive
 9217: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9218: 				      exit(normal)
 9219: 			      end
 9220: 		      end),
 9221:     LSock1 = receive
 9222: 		 {socket, L} ->
 9223: 		     ?P("received socket from owner"),
 9224: 		     L;
 9225: 		 {'DOWN', OwnerMon, process, OwnerPid, OwnerReason} ->
 9226: 		     ?P("received unexpected owner termination: "
 9227: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9228: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9229: 	     end,
 9230:     F  = fun(S, Fun) -> spawn_monitor(fun() -> Fun(S, Self) end) end,
 9231:     F1 = fun(Socket, Parent) when is_pid(Parent) ->
 9232: 		 ?P("[client] create monitor"),
 9233: 		 MRef = inet:monitor(Socket),
 9234: 		 Parent ! {self(), ready},
 9235: 		 sm_await_socket_down(MRef, Socket, Type)
 9236: 	 end,
 9237:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9238:     {Pid1, Mon1} = F(LSock1, F1),
 9239:     ?P("spawn client"),
 9240:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9241:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9242:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9243:     ?P("await owner termination"),
 9244:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9245:     ?P("await client termination"),
 9246:     sm_await_down(Pid1, Mon1, ok),
 9247:     ?P("done"),
 9248:     ok.

 9274:     Self         = self(),

 9276:     {OwnerPid, OwnerMon} =
 9277: 	spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 9278: 			      ?P("[owner] create (listen) socket(s)"),
 9279: 			      {ok, L1} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9280: 			      {ok, L2} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),

 9288: 				  {Self, die} ->
 9289: 				      exit(normal)
 9290: 			      end
 9291: 		      end),
 9292:     ?P("await sockets (from owner)"),

 9299: 			"~n   ~p", [OwnerReason]),
 9300: 		     ct:fail({unexpected_owner_termination, OwnerReason})
 9301: 	     end,

 9303:     F1 = fun(Sockets, Parent) when is_list(Sockets) andalso is_pid(Parent) ->

 9306: 				Socket <- Sockets],

 9309: 		 sm_await_socket_down2(Monitors, Type)
 9310: 	 end,

 9313:     ?P("await client ready"),
 9314:     sm_await_client_ready(Pid1),
 9315:     ?P("kill owner"),
 9316:     exit(OwnerPid, kill),
 9317:     ?P("await owner (~p) termination", [OwnerPid]),
 9318:     sm_await_down(OwnerPid, OwnerMon, killed),
 9319:     ?P("await client termination"),

 9405: %% processes that create monitors to it...
 9406: otp_17492(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9407:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9408:     Cond = fun() -> ok end,
 9409:     Pre  = fun() -> case ?WHICH_LOCAL_ADDR(inet) of
 9410:                         {ok, Addr} ->
 9411:                             Addr;
 9412:                         {error, Reason} ->
 9413:                             throw({skip, Reason})
 9414:                     end
 9415:            end,
 9416:     TC   = fun(Addr) -> do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) end,
 9417:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9418:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, TC, Post).
 9419: 
 9420: do_otp_17492(Config, Addr) ->
 9421:     ?P("begin"),
 9422: 
 9423:     Self = self(),
 9424: 
 9425:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9426:     {ok, L} = ?LISTEN(Config, 0, [{ip, Addr}]),
 9427: 
 9428:     ?P("try get (created) listen socket info"),
 9429:     try inet:info(L) of
 9430: 	#{owner := Owner} = Info when is_pid(Owner) andalso (Owner =:= Self) ->
 9431: 	    ?P("(created) Listen socket info: ~p", [Info]);
 9432: 	OBadInfo ->
 9433: 	    ?P("(created) listen socket info: ~p", [OBadInfo]),
 9434: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9435: 	    ct:fail({invalid_created_info, OBadInfo})
 9436:     catch
 9437: 	OC:OE:OS ->
 9438: 	    ?P("Failed get (created) listen socket info: "
 9439: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9440: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9441: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [OC, OE, OS]),
 9442: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9443: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_created_info_result, {OC, OE, OS}})
 9444:     end,
 9445: 
 9446:     ?P("try close (listen) socket"),
 9447:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 9448: 
 9449:     ?P("try get (closed) listen socket info"),
 9450:     try inet:info(L) of
 9451: 	#{states := [closed]} = CInfo when is_port(L) ->
 9452: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9453: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9454: 	#{rstates := [closed], wstates := [closed]} = CInfo ->
 9455: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: "
 9456: 	       "~n   ~p", [CInfo]);
 9457: 	CBadInfo ->
 9458: 	    ?P("(closed) listen socket info: ~p", [CBadInfo]),
 9459: 	    ct:fail({invalid_closed_info, CBadInfo})
 9460:     catch
 9461: 	CC:CE:CS ->
 9462: 	    ?P("Failed get (closed) listen socket info: "
 9463: 	       "~n   Class: ~p"
 9464: 	       "~n   Error: ~p"
 9465: 	       "~n   Stack: ~p", [CC, CE, CS]),
 9466: 	    (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9467: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_closed_info_result, {CC, CE, CS}})
 9468:     end,
 9469: 
 9470:     ?P("done"),
 9471:     ok.
 9472: 
 9473: 
 9474: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9475: 
 9476: %% Check that we can connect with the option 'bind_to_device'
 9477: %% and the inet_backend option set to socket.
 9478: %% The value types *where* mutually exclusive:
 9479: %% prim_inet: binary()
 9480: %% socket:    string()
 9481: otp_18357(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9482:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(30)),
 9483:     Cond = fun() ->
 9484:                    is_socket_supported(),
 9485:                    has_support_sock_bindtodevice()
 9486:            end,
 9487:     Pre  = fun() ->
 9488:                    case ?LIB:which_local_host_info(inet) of
 9489:                        {ok, [#{name := Name, addr := Addr}|_]} ->
 9490:                            ?P("~w:pre -> local host info:"
 9491:                               "~n   (IF) Name: ~p"
 9492:                               "~n   (IF) Addr: ~p",
 9493:                               [?FUNCTION_NAME, Name, Addr]),
 9494:                            #{name => Name, addr => Addr};
 9495:                        {error, Reason} ->
 9496:                            {skip, ?F("Failed get local address: ~p", [Reason])}
 9497:                    end
 9498:            end,
 9499:     Case = fun(State) -> do_otp_18357(State) end,
 9500:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9501:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 9502: 
 9503: do_otp_18357(#{name := Name, addr := Addr}) ->
 9504:     ?P("try create listen socket"),
 9505:     {ok, L}      = gen_tcp:listen(0,
 9506:                                   [{inet_backend, socket},
 9507:                                    {debug,        true},
 9508:                                    {ifaddr,       Addr}]),
 9509:     {ok, PortNo} = inet:port(L),
 9510: 
 9511:     ?P("try connect (with bind-to-device)"),
 9512:     OS = which_os(),
 9513:     C = case gen_tcp:connect(Addr, PortNo,
 9514:                              [{inet_backend,   socket},
 9515:                               {debug,          true},
 9516:                               {bind_to_device, list_to_binary(Name)}]) of
 9517:             {ok, CSock} ->
 9518:                 CSock;
 9519:             {error, einval = Reason} when (OS =:= darwin) ->
 9520:                 %% This is a failure to set the bind_to_device option
 9521:                 %% (usually...)
 9522:                 ?P("Failed connecting (on ~w), ~p, skipping", [OS, Reason]),
 9523:                 (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9524:                 skip(Reason);
 9525:             {error, eperm = Reason} ->
 9526:                 ?P("Failed connecting, ~p, skipping", [Reason]),
 9527:                 (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9528:                 skip(Reason)
 9529:         end,
 9530: 
 9531:     ?P("try accept"),
 9532:     {ok, A} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 9533: 
 9534:     ?P("cleanup"),
 9535:     (catch gen_tcp:close(C)),
 9536:     (catch gen_tcp:close(A)),
 9537:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L)),
 9538: 
 9539:     ?P("done"),
 9540:     ok.
 9541: 
 9542: 
 9543: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9544: 
 9545: otp_18883(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9546:     ct:timetrap(?SECS(10)),
 9547:     Cond = fun() ->
 9548:                    is_socket_supported(),
 9549:                    is_linux()
 9550:            end,
 9551:     Pre  = fun() -> undefined end,
 9552:     Case = fun(_) -> do_otp_18883() end,
 9553:     Post = fun(_) -> ok end,
 9554:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME, Cond, Pre, Case, Post).
 9555: 
 9556: do_otp_18883() ->
 9557:     Opts = [{inet_backend, socket},
 9558:             {debug, true},
 9559:             {active, false},
 9560:             {reuseaddr, true},
 9561:             {raw, 1, 15, <<1:32/native>>}],
 9562:     
 9563:     ?P("Create first listen socket"),
 9564:     {ok, L1}   = gen_tcp:listen(0, Opts),
 9565:     {ok, Port} = inet:port(L1),
 9566: 
 9567:     ?P("Create second listen socket with the same port number as first: ~w",
 9568:        [Port]),
 9569:     {ok, L2}   = gen_tcp:listen(Port, Opts),
 9570: 
 9571:     ?P("success - cleanup"),
 9572:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L1)),
 9573:     (catch gen_tcp:close(L2)),
 9574: 
 9575:     ?P("done"),
 9576:     ok.
 9577: 
 9578: 
 9579: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9580: 
 9581: %% This is the most basic of tests.
 9582: otp_18707(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9583:     ct:timetrap(?MINS(1)),
 9584:     ?TC_TRY(?FUNCTION_NAME,
 9585:             fun() ->
 9586:                     %% We are not actually trying to make a connection...
 9587:                     is_socket_supported(),
 9588:                     case ?EXPLICIT_INET_BACKEND() of
 9589:                         true ->
 9590:                             case ?WHICH_INET_BACKEND(Config) of
 9591:                                 socket ->
 9592:                                     ok;
 9593:                                 Backend ->
 9594:                                     ?SKIPT({backend, Backend})
 9595:                             end;
 9596:                         _ ->
 9597:                             ok
 9598:                     end
 9599:             end,
 9600:             fun() -> do_otp_18707(Config) end).
 9601: 
 9602: do_otp_18707(_Config) ->
 9603:     ?P("begin"),
 9604: 
 9605:     try gen_tcp:connect(#{port   => 80,
 9606:                           addr   => {127, 0, 0, 1},
 9607:                           family => inet},
 9608:                         [{inet_backend, socket}]) of
 9609:         {ok, Sock} ->
 9610:             %% Since we do not know what is going on
 9611:             %% on the machines we run the tests, this
 9612:             %% call "might" actually succeed...
 9613:             ?P("(expected) connect success"),
 9614:             gen_tcp:close(Sock),
 9615:             ok;
 9616:         {error, _Reason} ->
 9617:             ?P("expected failure: "
 9618:                "~n   ~p", [_Reason]),
 9619:             ok
 9620:     catch
 9621:         C:E:S ->
 9622:             ?P("unexpected failure: "
 9623:                "~n   C: ~p"
 9624:                "~n   E: ~p"
 9625:                "~n   S: ~p", [C, E, S]),
 9626:             ct:fail({unexpected_failure, C, E, S})
 9627:     end,
 9628: 
 9629:     ?P("done"),
 9630:     ok.
 9631: 
 9632: 
 9633: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9634: 
 9635: send_block_unblock(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 9636:     Size = 2048,
 9637:     Timeout = 500,
 9638:     Payload = payload(Size),
 9639:     BufSize = Size + (Size bsr 3), % + 12.5% - need to fill buffer > 75%
 9640:     io:format(
 9641:       "[~w] Payload size ~w, send timeout ~w~n", [self(), Size, Timeout]),
 9642:     Opts =
 9643:         [binary,
 9644:          {active, false},
 9645:          {exit_on_close, false},
 9646:          {show_econnreset, true},
 9647:          {high_watermark, Size * 6},
 9648:          {low_watermark, Size * 2},
 9649:          {sndbuf, BufSize},
 9650:          {recbuf, BufSize},
 9651:          {buffer, BufSize},
 9652:          {packet, 4}],
 9653:     {ok, L}  = gen_tcp:listen(0, Opts),
 9654:     {ok, P}  = inet:port(L),
 9655:     {ok, Sa} = gen_tcp:connect({127,0,0,1}, P, Opts),
 9656:     {ok, Sb} = gen_tcp:accept(L),
 9657:     ok = gen_tcp:close(L),
 9658:     {ok, Pa}  = inet:port(Sa),
 9659:     io:format("[~w] Listen port ~w, connect port ~w~n", [self(), P, Pa]),
 9660:     io:format("[~w] Accept socket ~w, connect socket ~w~n", [self(), Sb, Sa]),
 9661:     inet:i(),
 9662:     %% ok = inet:setopts(Sa, [{debug, true}]),
 9663:     fill_send_buffers(Payload, Sa, Sb, Timeout, 0).
 9664: 
 9665: fill_send_buffers(Payload, Sa, Sb, Timeout, N) ->
 9666:     N_1 = N + 1,
 9667:     case send_maybe_block(Sa, <<N:16, Payload/binary>>, Timeout) of
 9668:         ok ->
 9669:             io:format("[~w] Sent ~w~n", [self(), N]),
 9670:             fill_send_buffers(Payload, Sa, Sb, Timeout, N_1);
 9671:         Ref when is_reference(Ref) ->
 9672:             io:format("[~w] Send ~w pending ~w~n", [self(), N, Ref]),
 9673:             case send_maybe_block(Sa, <<N_1:16, Payload/binary>>, Timeout) of
 9674:                 Ref2 when is_reference(Ref2) ->
 9675:                 io:format("[~w] Send ~w pending ~w~n", [self(), N_1, Ref2]),
 9676:                     _ =
 9677:                         spawn_link(
 9678:                           fun () ->
 9679:                                   receive after Timeout -> ok end,
 9680:                                   loop_data(Sb)
 9681:                           end),
 9682:                     recv_data(Payload, Sa, Ref, Ref2, N_1, 0)
 9683:             end
 9684:     end.
 9685: 
 9686: recv_data(_Payload, Sa, Ref, Ref2, M, N) when M < N ->
 9687:     receive {send_result, Ref, ok} ->
 9688:             io:format("[~w] Send finished ~w~n", [self(), Ref]),
 9689:             receive {send_result, Ref2, ok} ->
 9690:                     io:format("[~w] Send finished ~w~n", [self(), Ref2]),
 9691:                     gen_tcp:shutdown(Sa, write),
 9692:                     {error, closed} = gen_tcp:recv(Sa, 0),
 9693:                     io:format("[~w] Recv closed~n", [self()]),
 9694:                     ok = gen_tcp:close(Sa),
 9695:                     receive Unexpected ->
 9696:                             ct:fail({unexpected, Unexpected})
 9697:                     after 0 ->
 9698:                             inet:i()
 9699:                     end
 9700:             end
 9701:     end;
 9702: recv_data(Payload, Sa, Ref, Ref2, M, N) ->
 9703:     Data = <<N:16, Payload/binary>>,
 9704:     {ok, Data} = gen_tcp:recv(Sa, 0),
 9705:     io:format("[~w] Recv ~w~n", [self(), N]),
 9706:     recv_data(Payload, Sa, Ref, Ref2, M, N + 1).
 9707: 
 9708: send_maybe_block(S, Data, Timeout) ->
 9709:     Parent = self(),
 9710:     Ref = make_ref(),
 9711:     _ =
 9712:         spawn_link(
 9713:           fun () ->
 9714:                   Parent ! {send_result, Ref, gen_tcp:send(S, Data)}
 9715:           end),
 9716:     receive
 9717:         {send_result, Ref, Result} ->
 9718:             false = is_reference(Result), %% Just to make it impossible
 9719:             Result
 9720:     after Timeout ->
 9721:             Ref
 9722:     end.
 9723: 
 9724: loop_data(S) ->
 9725:     case gen_tcp:recv(S, 0) of
 9726:         {ok, Data} ->
 9727:             io:format("[~w] Echo recv~n", [self()]),
 9728:             ok = gen_tcp:send(S, Data),
 9729:             io:format("[~w] Echo sent~n", [self()]),
 9730:             loop_data(S);
 9731:         {error, closed} ->
 9732:             io:format("[~w] Echo recv closed~n", [self()]),
 9733:             ok = gen_tcp:close(S)
 9734:     end.
 9735: 
 9736: payload(N) when is_integer(N), 0 =< N ->
 9737:     payload(N, <<>>).
 9738: %%
 9739: payload(0, Bin) -> Bin;
 9740: payload(N, Bin) ->
 9741:     C = rand:uniform($z - $0 + 1) + $0,
 9742:     payload(N - 1, <<Bin/binary, C>>).
 9743: 
 9744: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9745: 
 9746: is_windows() ->
 9747:     case os:type() of
 9748:         {win32, nt} ->
 9749:             true;
 9750:         _ ->
 9751:             false
 9752:     end.
 9753: 
 9754: is_linux() ->
 9755:     is_unix(linux, "Linux").
 9756: 
 9757: is_unix(Name, PlatformStr) ->
 9758:     is_platform(unix, Name, PlatformStr).
 9759: 
 9760: is_platform(Family, Name, PlatformStr)
 9761:   when is_atom(Family) andalso
 9762:        is_atom(Name) andalso
 9763:        is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 9764:     case os:type() of
 9765:         {Family, Name} ->
 9766:             ok;
 9767:         _ ->
 9768:             skip("Require " ++ PlatformStr)
 9769:     end.
 9770: 
 9771: is_not_sunos() ->
 9772:     is_not_unix(sunos, "SunOS").
 9773: 
 9774: is_not_unix(Name, PlatformStr) ->
 9775:     is_not_platform(unix, Name, PlatformStr).
 9776: 
 9777: is_not_platform(Family, Name, PlatformStr)
 9778:   when is_atom(Family) andalso
 9779:        is_atom(Name) andalso
 9780:        is_list(PlatformStr) ->
 9781:     case os:type() of
 9782:         {Family, Name} ->
 9783:             skip("Require *not* " ++ PlatformStr);
 9784:         _ ->
 9785:             ok
 9786:     end.
 9787: 
 9788: 
 9789: is_socket_supported() ->
 9790:     try socket:info() of
 9791:         #{} ->
 9792:             ok
 9793:     catch
 9794:         error : notsup ->
 9795:             skip("esock not supported");
 9796:         error : undef ->
 9797:             skip("esock not configured")
 9798:     end.
 9799: 
 9800: has_support_sock_priority() ->
 9801:     has_support_socket_option_sock(priority).
 9802: 
 9803: has_support_sock_bindtodevice() ->
 9804:     has_support_socket_option_sock(bindtodevice).
 9805: 
 9806: has_support_socket_option_sock(Opt) ->
 9807:     has_support_socket_option(socket, Opt).
 9808: 
 9809: has_support_socket_option(Level, Option) ->
 9810:     case socket:is_supported(options, Level, Option) of
 9811:         true ->
 9812:             ok;
 9813:         false ->
 9814:             skip(?F("Not Supported: ~w option ~w", [Level, Option]))
 9815:     end.
 9816: 
 9817: 
 9818: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9819: 
 9820: skip(Reason) ->
 9821:     throw({skip, Reason}).
 9822: 
 9823: 
 9824: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 9825: 
 9826: %% This is a simplified os:type()
 9827: which_os() ->
 9828:     %% Need this for the error handling
 9829:     case os:type() of
 9830:         {unix, Flavor} ->
 9831:             Flavor;
 9832:         {win32, nt} ->
 9833:             windows;
 9834:         _ ->
 9835:             other % We do not really care...
 9836:     end.
 9837: 
 9838: 
 9839: messages() ->
 9840:     pi(messages).
 9841: 
 9842: links() ->
 9843:     pi(links).
 9844: 
 9845: monitors() ->
 9846:     pi(monitors).
 9847: 
 9848: pi(Pid) when is_pid(Pid) ->
 9849:     process_info(Pid);
 9850: 
 9851: pi(Item) ->
 9852:     pi(self(), Item).
 9853: 
 9854: pi(Pid, Item) ->
 9855:     {Item, Val} = process_info(Pid, Item),
 9856:     Val.    
 9857:

 9865:     ?F("Connect failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9866: 
 9867: listen_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9868:     ?F("Listen failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9869: 
 9870: accept_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9871:     ?F("Accept failed: ~w", [Reason]).
 9872: 
 9873: port_failed_str(Reason) ->
 9874:     ?F("Port failed: ~w", [Reason]).
